API endpoints can provide any number of services, such as " "authentication, sales data, performance meters, Compute VM commands, census " "data, and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:189 msgid "API extension" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:192 msgid "Custom modules that extend some OpenStack core APIs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:193 msgid "API extension plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:196 msgid "Alternative term for a Networking plug-in or Networking API extension." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:198 msgid "API key" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:201 msgid "Alternative term for an API token." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:202 msgid "API server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:205 msgid "Any node running a daemon or worker that provides an API endpoint." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:207 msgid "API token" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:210 msgid "" "Passed to API requests and used by OpenStack to verify that the client is " "authorized to run the requested operation." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:212 msgid "API version" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:215 msgid "" "In OpenStack, the API version for a project is part of the URL. For example, " "``example.com/nova/v1/foobar``." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:217 msgid "applet" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:220 msgid "A Java program that can be embedded into a web page." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:221 msgid "Application Programming Interface (API)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:224 msgid "" "A collection of specifications used to access a service, application, or " "program. Includes service calls, required parameters for each call, and the " "expected return values." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:230 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides an application catalog service so that users " "can compose and deploy composite environments on an application abstraction " "level while managing the application lifecycle. The code name of the project " "is murano." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:235 msgid "application server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:238 msgid "" "A piece of software that makes available another piece of software over a " "network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:240 msgid "Application Service Provider (ASP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:243 msgid "" "Companies that rent specialized applications that help businesses and " "organizations provide additional services with lower cost." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:246 msgid "Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:249 msgid "" "The protocol by which layer-3 IP addresses are resolved into layer-2 link " "local addresses." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:251 msgid "arptables" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:254 msgid "" "Tool used for maintaining Address Resolution Protocol packet filter rules in " "the Linux kernel firewall modules. Used along with iptables, ebtables, and " "ip6tables in Compute to provide firewall services for VMs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:258 msgid "associate" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:261 msgid "" "The process associating a Compute floating IP address with a fixed IP " "address." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:263 msgid "Asynchronous JavaScript and XML (AJAX)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:266 msgid "" "A group of interrelated web development techniques used on the client-side " "to create asynchronous web applications. Used extensively in horizon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:269 msgid "ATA over Ethernet (AoE)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:272 msgid "A disk storage protocol tunneled within Ethernet." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:273 msgid "attach" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:276 msgid "" "The process of connecting a VIF or vNIC to a L2 network in Networking. In " "the context of Compute, this process connects a storage volume to an " "instance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:279 msgid "attachment (network)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:282 msgid "" "Association of an interface ID to a logical port. Plugs an interface into a " "port." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:284 msgid "auditing" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:287 msgid "Provided in Compute through the system usage data facility." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:289 msgid "auditor" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:292 msgid "" "A worker process that verifies the integrity of Object Storage objects, " "containers, and accounts. Auditors is the collective term for the Object " "Storage account auditor, container auditor, and object auditor." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:296 msgid "Austin" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:299 msgid "" "The code name for the initial release of OpenStack. The first design summit " "took place in Austin, Texas, US." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:302 msgid "auth node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:305 msgid "Alternative term for an Object Storage authorization node." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:307 msgid "authentication" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:310 msgid "" "The process that confirms that the user, process, or client is really who " "they say they are through private key, secret token, password, fingerprint, " "or similar method." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:313 msgid "authentication token" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:316 msgid "" "A string of text provided to the client after authentication. Must be " "provided by the user or process in subsequent requests to the API endpoint." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:319 msgid "AuthN" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:322 msgid "The Identity service component that provides authentication services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:324 msgid "authorization" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:327 msgid "" "The act of verifying that a user, process, or client is authorized to " "perform an action." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:329 msgid "authorization node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:332 msgid "An Object Storage node that provides authorization services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:334 msgid "AuthZ" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:337 msgid "The Identity component that provides high-level authorization services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:339 msgid "Auto ACK" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:342 msgid "" "Configuration setting within RabbitMQ that enables or disables message " "acknowledgment. Enabled by default." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:344 msgid "auto declare" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:347 msgid "" "A Compute RabbitMQ setting that determines whether a message exchange is " "automatically created when the program starts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:349 msgid "availability zone" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:352 msgid "" "An Amazon EC2 concept of an isolated area that is used for fault tolerance. " "Do not confuse with an OpenStack Compute zone or cell." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:355 msgid "AWS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:358 msgid "Amazon Web Services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:359 msgid "AWS CloudFormation template" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:362 msgid "" "AWS CloudFormation allows AWS users to create and manage a collection of " "related resources. The Orchestration service supports a CloudFormation-" "compatible format (CFN)." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:365 msgid "back end" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:368 msgid "" "Interactions and processes that are obfuscated from the user, such as " "Compute volume mount, data transmission to an iSCSI target by a daemon, or " "Object Storage object integrity checks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:371 msgid "back-end catalog" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:374 msgid "" "The storage method used by the Identity service catalog service to store and " "retrieve information about API endpoints that are available to the client. " "Examples include an SQL database, LDAP database, or KVS back end." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:378 msgid "back-end store" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:381 msgid "" "The persistent data store used to save and retrieve information for a " "service, such as lists of Object Storage objects, current state of guest " "VMs, lists of user names, and so on. Also, the method that the Image service " "uses to get and store VM images. Options include Object Storage, local file " "system, S3, and HTTP." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:386 msgid "backup restore and disaster recovery as a service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:389 msgid "" "The OpenStack project that provides integrated tooling for backing up, " "restoring, and recovering file systems, instances, or database backups. The " "project name is freezer." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:392 msgid "bandwidth" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:395 msgid "" "The amount of available data used by communication resources, such as the " "Internet. Represents the amount of data that is used to download things or " "the amount of data available to download." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:401 msgid "Code name of the key management service for OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:402 msgid "bare" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:405 msgid "" "An Image service container format that indicates that no container exists " "for the VM image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:410 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provisions bare metal, as opposed to virtual, " "machines. The code name for the project is ironic." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:412 msgid "base image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:415 msgid "An OpenStack-provided image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:416 msgid "Bell-LaPadula model" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:419 msgid "" "A security model that focuses on data confidentiality and controlled access " "to classified information. This model divide the entities into subjects and " "objects. The clearance of a subject is compared to the classification of the " "object to determine if the subject is authorized for the specific access " "mode. The clearance or classification scheme is expressed in terms of a " "lattice." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:425 msgid "Benchmark service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:428 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides a framework for performance analysis and " "benchmarking of individual OpenStack components as well as full production " "OpenStack cloud deployments. The code name of the project is rally." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:432 msgid "Bexar" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:435 msgid "" "A grouped release of projects related to OpenStack that came out in February " "of 2011. It included only Compute (nova) and Object Storage (swift). Bexar " "is the code name for the second release of OpenStack. The design summit took " "place in San Antonio, Texas, US, which is the county seat for Bexar county." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:441 msgid "binary" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:444 msgid "" "Information that consists solely of ones and zeroes, which is the language " "of computers." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:446 msgid "bit" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:449 msgid "" "A bit is a single digit number that is in base of 2 (either a zero or one). " "Bandwidth usage is measured in bits per second." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:451 msgid "bits per second (BPS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:454 msgid "" "The universal measurement of how quickly data is transferred from place to " "place." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:456 msgid "block device" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:459 msgid "" "A device that moves data in the form of blocks. These device nodes interface " "the devices, such as hard disks, CD-ROM drives, flash drives, and other " "addressable regions of memory." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:462 msgid "block migration" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:465 msgid "" "A method of VM live migration used by KVM to evacuate instances from one " "host to another with very little downtime during a user-initiated " "switchover. Does not require shared storage. Supported by Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:472 msgid "" "The OpenStack core project that enables management of volumes, volume " "snapshots, and volume types. The project name of Block Storage is cinder." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:475 msgid "Block Storage API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:478 msgid "" "An API on a separate endpoint for attaching, detaching, and creating block " "storage for compute VMs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:481 msgid "BMC" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:484 msgid "" "Baseboard Management Controller. The intelligence in the IPMI architecture, " "which is a specialized micro-controller that is embedded on the motherboard " "of a computer and acts as a server. Manages the interface between system " "management software and platform hardware." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:489 msgid "bootable disk image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:492 msgid "A type of VM image that exists as a single, bootable file." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:494 msgid "Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:497 msgid "" "A network protocol used by a network client to obtain an IP address from a " "configuration server. Provided in Compute through the dnsmasq daemon when " "using either the FlatDHCP manager or VLAN manager network manager." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:501 msgid "Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:504 msgid "" "The Border Gateway Protocol is a dynamic routing protocol that connects " "autonomous systems. Considered the backbone of the Internet, this protocol " "connects disparate networks to form a larger network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:508 msgid "browser" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:511 msgid "" "Any client software that enables a computer or device to access the Internet." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:513 msgid "builder file" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:516 msgid "" "Contains configuration information that Object Storage uses to reconfigure a " "ring or to re-create it from scratch after a serious failure." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:519 msgid "bursting" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:522 msgid "" "The practice of utilizing a secondary environment to elastically build " "instances on-demand when the primary environment is resource constrained." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:525 msgid "button class" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:528 msgid "" "A group of related button types within horizon. Buttons to start, stop, and " "suspend VMs are in one class. Buttons to associate and disassociate floating " "IP addresses are in another class, and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:532 msgid "byte" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:535 msgid "" "Set of bits that make up a single character; there are usually 8 bits to a " "byte." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:537 msgid "CA" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:540 msgid "" "Certificate Authority or Certification Authority. In cryptography, an entity " "that issues digital certificates. The digital certificate certifies the " "ownership of a public key by the named subject of the certificate. This " "enables others (relying parties) to rely upon signatures or assertions made " "by the private key that corresponds to the certified public key. In this " "model of trust relationships, a CA is a trusted third party for both the " "subject (owner) of the certificate and the party relying upon the " "certificate. CAs are characteristic of many public key infrastructure (PKI) " "schemes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:550 msgid "cache pruner" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:553 msgid "" "A program that keeps the Image service VM image cache at or below its " "configured maximum size." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:555 msgid "Cactus" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:558 msgid "" "An OpenStack grouped release of projects that came out in the spring of " "2011. It included Compute (nova), Object Storage (swift), and the Image " "service (glance). Cactus is a city in Texas, US and is the code name for the " "third release of OpenStack. When OpenStack releases went from three to six " "months long, the code name of the release changed to match a geography " "nearest the previous summit." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:566 msgid "CADF" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:569 msgid "" "Cloud Auditing Data Federation (CADF) is a specification for audit event " "data. CADF is supported by OpenStack Identity." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:572 msgid "CALL" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:575 msgid "" "One of the RPC primitives used by the OpenStack message queue software. " "Sends a message and waits for a response." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:577 msgid "capability" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:580 msgid "" "Defines resources for a cell, including CPU, storage, and networking. Can " "apply to the specific services within a cell or a whole cell." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:583 msgid "capacity cache" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:586 msgid "" "A Compute back-end database table that contains the current workload, amount " "of free RAM, and number of VMs running on each host. Used to determine on " "which host a VM starts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:589 msgid "capacity updater" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:592 msgid "" "A notification driver that monitors VM instances and updates the capacity " "cache as needed." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:594 msgid "CAST" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:597 msgid "" "One of the RPC primitives used by the OpenStack message queue software. " "Sends a message and does not wait for a response." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:599 msgid "catalog" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:602 msgid "" "A list of API endpoints that are available to a user after authentication " "with the Identity service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:604 msgid "catalog service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:607 msgid "" "An Identity service that lists API endpoints that are available to a user " "after authentication with the Identity service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:612 msgid "" "The project name for the Telemetry service, which is an integrated project " "that provides metering and measuring facilities for OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:615 msgid "cell" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:618 msgid "" "Provides logical partitioning of Compute resources in a child and parent " "relationship. Requests are passed from parent cells to child cells if the " "parent cannot provide the requested resource." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:622 msgid "cell forwarding" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:625 msgid "" "A Compute option that enables parent cells to pass resource requests to " "child cells if the parent cannot provide the requested resource." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:628 msgid "cell manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:631 msgid "" "The Compute component that contains a list of the current capabilities of " "each host within the cell and routes requests as appropriate." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:634 msgid "CentOS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:637 ../common/glossary.rst:1026 #: ../common/glossary.rst:2676 ../common/glossary.rst:3019 #: ../common/glossary.rst:3501 msgid "A Linux distribution that is compatible with OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:638 msgid "Ceph" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:641 msgid "" "Massively scalable distributed storage system that consists of an object " "store, block store, and POSIX-compatible distributed file system. Compatible " "with OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:644 msgid "CephFS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:647 msgid "The POSIX-compliant file system provided by Ceph." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:648 msgid "certificate authority" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:651 msgid "" "A simple certificate authority provided by Compute for cloudpipe VPNs and VM " "image decryption." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:653 msgid "Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:656 msgid "An iSCSI authentication method supported by Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:657 msgid "chance scheduler" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:660 msgid "" "A scheduling method used by Compute that randomly chooses an available host " "from the pool." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:662 msgid "changes since" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:665 msgid "" "A Compute API parameter that downloads changes to the requested item since " "your last request, instead of downloading a new, fresh set of data and " "comparing it against the old data." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:668 msgid "Chef" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:671 msgid "" "An operating system configuration management tool supporting OpenStack " "deployments." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:673 msgid "child cell" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:676 msgid "" "If a requested resource such as CPU time, disk storage, or memory is not " "available in the parent cell, the request is forwarded to its associated " "child cells. If the child cell can fulfill the request, it does. Otherwise, " "it attempts to pass the request to any of its children." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:684 msgid "A core OpenStack project that provides block storage services for VMs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:686 msgid "CirrOS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:689 msgid "" "A minimal Linux distribution designed for use as a test image on clouds such " "as OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:691 msgid "Cisco neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:694 msgid "" "A Networking plug-in for Cisco devices and technologies, including UCS and " "Nexus." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:696 msgid "cloud architect" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:699 msgid "A person who plans, designs, and oversees the creation of clouds." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:701 msgid "cloud computing" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:704 msgid "" "A model that enables access to a shared pool of configurable computing " "resources, such as networks, servers, storage, applications, and services, " "that can be rapidly provisioned and released with minimal management effort " "or service provider interaction." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:708 msgid "cloud controller" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:711 msgid "" "Collection of Compute components that represent the global state of the " "cloud; talks to services, such as Identity authentication, Object Storage, " "and node/storage workers through a queue." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:715 msgid "cloud controller node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:718 msgid "" "A node that runs network, volume, API, scheduler, and image services. Each " "service may be broken out into separate nodes for scalability or " "availability." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:721 msgid "Cloud Data Management Interface (CDMI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:724 msgid "" "SINA standard that defines a RESTful API for managing objects in the cloud, " "currently unsupported in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:726 msgid "Cloud Infrastructure Management Interface (CIMI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:729 msgid "" "An in-progress specification for cloud management. Currently unsupported in " "OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:731 msgid "cloud-init" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:734 msgid "" "A package commonly installed in VM images that performs initialization of an " "instance after boot using information that it retrieves from the metadata " "service, such as the SSH public key and user data." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:738 msgid "cloudadmin" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:741 msgid "" "One of the default roles in the Compute RBAC system. Grants complete system " "access." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:743 msgid "Cloudbase-Init" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:746 msgid "" "A Windows project providing guest initialization features, similar to cloud-" "init." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:748 msgid "cloudpipe" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:751 msgid "A compute service that creates VPNs on a per-project basis." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:753 msgid "cloudpipe image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:756 msgid "" "A pre-made VM image that serves as a cloudpipe server. Essentially, OpenVPN " "running on Linux." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:761 msgid "" "The OpenStack project that OpenStack project that implements clustering " "services and libraries for the management of groups of homogeneous objects " "exposed by other OpenStack services. The project name of Clustering service " "is senlin." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:766 msgid "CMDB" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:769 msgid "Configuration Management Database." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:770 msgid "congress" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:773 msgid "OpenStack project that provides the Governance service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:774 msgid "command filter" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:777 msgid "Lists allowed commands within the Compute rootwrap facility." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:779 msgid "Common Internet File System (CIFS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:782 msgid "" "A file sharing protocol. It is a public or open variation of the original " "Server Message Block (SMB) protocol developed and used by Microsoft. Like " "the SMB protocol, CIFS runs at a higher level and uses the TCP/IP protocol." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:786 msgid "community project" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:789 msgid "" "A project that is not officially endorsed by the OpenStack Foundation. If " "the project is successful enough, it might be elevated to an incubated " "project and then to a core project, or it might be merged with the main code " "trunk." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:793 msgid "compression" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:796 msgid "" "Reducing the size of files by special encoding, the file can be decompressed " "again to its original content. OpenStack supports compression at the Linux " "file system level but does not support compression for things such as Object " "Storage objects or Image service VM images." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:804 msgid "" "The OpenStack core project that provides compute services. The project name " "of Compute service is nova." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:806 msgid "Compute API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:809 msgid "" "The nova-api daemon provides access to nova services. Can communicate with " "other APIs, such as the Amazon EC2 API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:812 msgid "compute controller" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:815 msgid "" "The Compute component that chooses suitable hosts on which to start VM " "instances." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:817 msgid "compute host" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:820 msgid "Physical host dedicated to running compute nodes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:821 msgid "compute node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:824 msgid "" "A node that runs the nova-compute daemon that manages VM instances that " "provide a wide range of services, such as web applications and analytics." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:830 msgid "Name for the Compute component that manages VMs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:831 msgid "compute worker" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:834 msgid "" "The Compute component that runs on each compute node and manages the VM " "instance lifecycle, including run, reboot, terminate, attach/detach volumes, " "and so on. Provided by the nova-compute daemon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:837 msgid "concatenated object" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:840 msgid "" "A set of segment objects that Object Storage combines and sends to the " "client." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:842 msgid "conductor" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:845 msgid "" "In Compute, conductor is the process that proxies database requests from the " "compute process. Using conductor improves security because compute nodes do " "not need direct access to the database." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:849 msgid "consistency window" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:852 msgid "" "The amount of time it takes for a new Object Storage object to become " "accessible to all clients." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:854 msgid "console log" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:857 msgid "Contains the output from a Linux VM console in Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:858 msgid "container" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:861 msgid "" "Organizes and stores objects in Object Storage. Similar to the concept of a " "Linux directory but cannot be nested. Alternative term for an Image service " "container format." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:864 msgid "container auditor" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:867 msgid "" "Checks for missing replicas or incorrect objects in specified Object Storage " "containers through queries to the SQLite back-end database." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:870 msgid "container database" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:873 msgid "" "A SQLite database that stores Object Storage containers and container " "metadata. The container server accesses this database." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:876 msgid "container format" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:879 msgid "" "A wrapper used by the Image service that contains a VM image and its " "associated metadata, such as machine state, OS disk size, and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:882 msgid "container server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:885 msgid "An Object Storage server that manages containers." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:889 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides a set of services for management of " "application containers in a multi-tenant cloud environment. The code name of " "the project name is magnum." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:892 msgid "container service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:895 msgid "" "The Object Storage component that provides container services, such as " "create, delete, list, and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:897 msgid "content delivery network (CDN)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:900 msgid "" "A content delivery network is a specialized network that is used to " "distribute content to clients, typically located close to the client for " "increased performance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:903 msgid "controller node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:906 msgid "Alternative term for a cloud controller node." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:907 msgid "core API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:910 msgid "" "Depending on context, the core API is either the OpenStack API or the main " "API of a specific core project, such as Compute, Networking, Image service, " "and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:913 msgid "core service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:916 msgid "" "An official OpenStack service defined as core by DefCore Committee. " "Currently, consists of Block Storage service (cinder), Compute service " "(nova), Identity service (keystone), Image service (glance), Networking " "service (neutron), and Object Storage service (swift)." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:921 msgid "cost" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:924 msgid "" "Under the Compute distributed scheduler, this is calculated by looking at " "the capabilities of each host relative to the flavor of the VM instance " "being requested." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:927 msgid "credentials" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:930 msgid "" "Data that is only known to or accessible by a user and used to verify that " "the user is who he says he is. Credentials are presented to the server " "during authentication. Examples include a password, secret key, digital " "certificate, and fingerprint." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:935 msgid "Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:938 msgid "" "A mechanism that allows many resources (for example, fonts, JavaScript) on a " "web page to be requested from another domain outside the domain from which " "the resource originated. In particular, JavaScript's AJAX calls can use the " "XMLHttpRequest mechanism." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:943 msgid "Crowbar" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:946 msgid "" "An open source community project by Dell that aims to provide all necessary " "services to quickly deploy clouds." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:948 msgid "current workload" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:951 msgid "" "An element of the Compute capacity cache that is calculated based on the " "number of build, snapshot, migrate, and resize operations currently in " "progress on a given host." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:954 msgid "customer" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:957 msgid "Alternative term for tenant." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:958 msgid "customization module" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:961 msgid "" "A user-created Python module that is loaded by horizon to change the look " "and feel of the dashboard." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:963 msgid "daemon" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:966 msgid "" "A process that runs in the background and waits for requests. May or may not " "listen on a TCP or UDP port. Do not confuse with a worker." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:969 msgid "DAC" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:972 msgid "" "Discretionary access control. Governs the ability of subjects to access " "objects, while enabling users to make policy decisions and assign security " "attributes. The traditional UNIX system of users, groups, and read-write-" "execute permissions is an example of DAC." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:977 msgid "Dashboard" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:980 msgid "" "The web-based management interface for OpenStack. An alternative name for " "horizon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:982 msgid "data encryption" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:985 msgid "" "Both Image service and Compute support encrypted virtual machine (VM) images " "(but not instances). In-transit data encryption is supported in OpenStack " "using technologies such as HTTPS, SSL, TLS, and SSH. Object Storage does not " "support object encryption at the application level but may support storage " "that uses disk encryption." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:990 msgid "database ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:993 msgid "A unique ID given to each replica of an Object Storage database." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:995 msgid "database replicator" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:998 msgid "" "An Object Storage component that copies changes in the account, container, " "and object databases to other nodes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1003 msgid "" "An integrated project that provide scalable and reliable Cloud Database-as-a-" "Service functionality for both relational and non-relational database " "engines. The project name of Database service is trove." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1010 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides a scalable data-processing stack and " "associated management interfaces. The code name for the project is sahara." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1013 msgid "data store" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1016 msgid "A database engine supported by the Database service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1017 msgid "deallocate" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1020 msgid "" "The process of removing the association between a floating IP address and a " "fixed IP address. Once this association is removed, the floating IP returns " "to the address pool." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1023 msgid "Debian" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1027 msgid "deduplication" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1030 msgid "" "The process of finding duplicate data at the disk block, file, and/or object " "level to minimize storage use—currently unsupported within OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1033 msgid "default panel" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1036 msgid "" "The default panel that is displayed when a user accesses the horizon " "dashboard." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1038 msgid "default tenant" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1041 msgid "" "New users are assigned to this tenant if no tenant is specified when a user " "is created." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1043 msgid "default token" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1046 msgid "" "An Identity service token that is not associated with a specific tenant and " "is exchanged for a scoped token." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1048 msgid "delayed delete" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1051 msgid "" "An option within Image service so that an image is deleted after a " "predefined number of seconds instead of immediately." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1053 msgid "delivery mode" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1056 msgid "" "Setting for the Compute RabbitMQ message delivery mode; can be set to either " "transient or persistent." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1058 msgid "denial of service (DoS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1061 msgid "" "Denial of service (DoS) is a short form for denial-of-service attack. This " "is a malicious attempt to prevent legitimate users from using a service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1064 msgid "deprecated auth" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1067 msgid "" "An option within Compute that enables administrators to create and manage " "users through the ``nova-manage`` command as opposed to using the Identity " "service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1073 msgid "Code name for the DNS service project for OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1074 msgid "Desktop-as-a-Service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1077 msgid "" "A platform that provides a suite of desktop environments that users access " "to receive a desktop experience from any location. This may provide general " "use, development, or even homogeneous testing environments." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1081 msgid "developer" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1084 msgid "" "One of the default roles in the Compute RBAC system and the default role " "assigned to a new user." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1086 msgid "device ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1089 msgid "Maps Object Storage partitions to physical storage devices." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1091 msgid "device weight" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1094 msgid "" "Distributes partitions proportionately across Object Storage devices based " "on the storage capacity of each device." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1096 msgid "DevStack" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1099 msgid "" "Community project that uses shell scripts to quickly build complete " "OpenStack development environments." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1101 msgid "DHCP" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1104 msgid "" "Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol. A network protocol that configures " "devices that are connected to a network so that they can communicate on that " "network by using the Internet Protocol (IP). The protocol is implemented in " "a client-server model where DHCP clients request configuration data, such as " "an IP address, a default route, and one or more DNS server addresses from a " "DHCP server." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1110 msgid "DHCP agent" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1113 msgid "" "OpenStack Networking agent that provides DHCP services for virtual networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1115 msgid "Diablo" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1118 msgid "" "A grouped release of projects related to OpenStack that came out in the fall " "of 2011, the fourth release of OpenStack. It included Compute (nova 2011.3), " "Object Storage (swift 1.4.3), and the Image service (glance). Diablo is the " "code name for the fourth release of OpenStack. The design summit took place " "in the Bay Area near Santa Clara, California, US and Diablo is a nearby city." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1126 msgid "direct consumer" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1129 msgid "" "An element of the Compute RabbitMQ that comes to life when a RPC call is " "executed. It connects to a direct exchange through a unique exclusive queue, " "sends the message, and terminates." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1132 msgid "direct exchange" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1135 msgid "" "A routing table that is created within the Compute RabbitMQ during RPC " "calls; one is created for each RPC call that is invoked." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1138 msgid "direct publisher" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1141 msgid "Element of RabbitMQ that provides a response to an incoming MQ message." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1143 msgid "disassociate" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1146 msgid "" "The process of removing the association between a floating IP address and " "fixed IP and thus returning the floating IP address to the address pool." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1149 msgid "disk encryption" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1152 msgid "" "The ability to encrypt data at the file system, disk partition, or whole-" "disk level. Supported within Compute VMs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1154 msgid "disk format" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1157 msgid "" "The underlying format that a disk image for a VM is stored as within the " "Image service back-end store. For example, AMI, ISO, QCOW2, VMDK, and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1160 msgid "dispersion" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1163 msgid "" "In Object Storage, tools to test and ensure dispersion of objects and " "containers to ensure fault tolerance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1165 msgid "distributed virtual router (DVR)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1168 msgid "" "Mechanism for highly-available multi-host routing when using OpenStack " "Networking (neutron)." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1170 msgid "Django" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1173 msgid "A web framework used extensively in horizon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1174 msgid "DNS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1177 msgid "" "Domain Name System. A hierarchical and distributed naming system for " "computers, services, and resources connected to the Internet or a private " "network. Associates a human-friendly names to IP addresses." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1181 msgid "DNS record" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1184 msgid "" "A record that specifies information about a particular domain and belongs to " "the domain." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1189 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides scalable, on demand, self service access to " "authoritative DNS services, in a technology-agnostic manner. The code name " "for the project is designate." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1193 msgid "dnsmasq" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1196 msgid "" "Daemon that provides DNS, DHCP, BOOTP, and TFTP services for virtual " "networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1198 msgid "domain" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1201 msgid "" "An Identity API v3 entity. Represents a collection of projects, groups and " "users that defines administrative boundaries for managing OpenStack Identity " "entities. On the Internet, separates a website from other sites. Often, the " "domain name has two or more parts that are separated by dots. For example, " "yahoo.com, usa.gov, harvard.edu, or mail.yahoo.com. Also, a domain is an " "entity or container of all DNS-related information containing one or more " "records." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1210 msgid "Domain Name System (DNS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1213 msgid "" "A system by which Internet domain name-to-address and address-to-name " "resolutions are determined. DNS helps navigate the Internet by translating " "the IP address into an address that is easier to remember. For example, " "translating 111.111.111.1 into www.yahoo.com. All domains and their " "components, such as mail servers, utilize DNS to resolve to the appropriate " "locations. DNS servers are usually set up in a master-slave relationship " "such that failure of the master invokes the slave. DNS servers might also be " "clustered or replicated such that changes made to one DNS server are " "automatically propagated to other active servers. In Compute, the support " "that enables associating DNS entries with floating IP addresses, nodes, or " "cells so that hostnames are consistent across reboots." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1227 msgid "download" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1230 msgid "" "The transfer of data, usually in the form of files, from one computer to " "another." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1232 msgid "DRTM" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1235 msgid "Dynamic root of trust measurement." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1236 msgid "durable exchange" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1239 msgid "" "The Compute RabbitMQ message exchange that remains active when the server " "restarts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1241 msgid "durable queue" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1244 msgid "" "A Compute RabbitMQ message queue that remains active when the server " "restarts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1246 msgid "Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1249 msgid "" "A method to automatically configure networking for a host at boot time. " "Provided by both Networking and Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1251 msgid "Dynamic HyperText Markup Language (DHTML)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1254 msgid "" "Pages that use HTML, JavaScript, and Cascading Style Sheets to enable users " "to interact with a web page or show simple animation." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1257 msgid "east-west traffic" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1260 msgid "" "Network traffic between servers in the same cloud or data center. See also " "north-south traffic." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1262 msgid "EBS boot volume" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1265 msgid "" "An Amazon EBS storage volume that contains a bootable VM image, currently " "unsupported in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1267 msgid "ebtables" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1270 msgid "" "Filtering tool for a Linux bridging firewall, enabling filtering of network " "traffic passing through a Linux bridge. Used in Compute along with " "arptables, iptables, and ip6tables to ensure isolation of network " "communications." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1274 msgid "EC2" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1277 msgid "The Amazon commercial compute product, similar to Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1279 msgid "EC2 access key" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1282 msgid "Used along with an EC2 secret key to access the Compute EC2 API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1284 msgid "EC2 API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1287 msgid "OpenStack supports accessing the Amazon EC2 API through Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1289 msgid "EC2 Compatibility API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1292 msgid "" "A Compute component that enables OpenStack to communicate with Amazon EC2." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1294 msgid "EC2 secret key" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1297 msgid "" "Used along with an EC2 access key when communicating with the Compute EC2 " "API; used to digitally sign each request." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1299 msgid "Elastic Block Storage (EBS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1302 msgid "The Amazon commercial block storage product." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1303 msgid "encryption" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1306 msgid "" "OpenStack supports encryption technologies such as HTTPS, SSH, SSL, TLS, " "digital certificates, and data encryption." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1308 msgid "endpoint" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1311 msgid "See API endpoint." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1312 msgid "endpoint registry" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1315 msgid "Alternative term for an Identity service catalog." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1316 msgid "encapsulation" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1319 msgid "" "The practice of placing one packet type within another for the purposes of " "abstracting or securing data. Examples include GRE, MPLS, or IPsec." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1322 msgid "endpoint template" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1325 msgid "" "A list of URL and port number endpoints that indicate where a service, such " "as Object Storage, Compute, Identity, and so on, can be accessed." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1328 msgid "entity" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1331 msgid "" "Any piece of hardware or software that wants to connect to the network " "services provided by Networking, the network connectivity service. An entity " "can make use of Networking by implementing a VIF." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1335 msgid "ephemeral image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1338 msgid "" "A VM image that does not save changes made to its volumes and reverts them " "to their original state after the instance is terminated." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1341 msgid "ephemeral volume" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1344 msgid "" "Volume that does not save the changes made to it and reverts to its original " "state when the current user relinquishes control." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1346 msgid "Essex" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1349 msgid "" "A grouped release of projects related to OpenStack that came out in April " "2012, the fifth release of OpenStack. It included Compute (nova 2012.1), " "Object Storage (swift 1.4.8), Image (glance), Identity (keystone), and " "Dashboard (horizon). Essex is the code name for the fifth release of " "OpenStack. The design summit took place in Boston, Massachusetts, US and " "Essex is a nearby city." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1356 msgid "ESXi" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1359 ../common/glossary.rst:2179 #: ../common/glossary.rst:3687 ../common/glossary.rst:3784 #: ../common/glossary.rst:3873 ../common/glossary.rst:3919 #: ../common/glossary.rst:3928 msgid "An OpenStack-supported hypervisor." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1360 msgid "ETag" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1363 msgid "" "MD5 hash of an object within Object Storage, used to ensure data integrity." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1365 msgid "euca2ools" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1368 msgid "" "A collection of command-line tools for administering VMs; most are " "compatible with OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1370 msgid "Eucalyptus Kernel Image (EKI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1373 msgid "Used along with an ERI to create an EMI." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1374 msgid "Eucalyptus Machine Image (EMI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1377 msgid "VM image container format supported by Image service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1378 msgid "Eucalyptus Ramdisk Image (ERI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1381 msgid "Used along with an EKI to create an EMI." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1382 msgid "evacuate" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1385 msgid "" "The process of migrating one or all virtual machine (VM) instances from one " "host to another, compatible with both shared storage live migration and " "block migration." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1388 msgid "exchange" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1391 msgid "Alternative term for a RabbitMQ message exchange." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1392 msgid "exchange type" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1395 msgid "A routing algorithm in the Compute RabbitMQ." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1396 msgid "exclusive queue" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1399 msgid "" "Connected to by a direct consumer in RabbitMQ—Compute, the message can be " "consumed only by the current connection." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1401 msgid "extended attributes (xattr)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1404 msgid "" "File system option that enables storage of additional information beyond " "owner, group, permissions, modification time, and so on. The underlying " "Object Storage file system must support extended attributes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1408 msgid "extension" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1411 msgid "" "Alternative term for an API extension or plug-in. In the context of Identity " "service, this is a call that is specific to the implementation, such as " "adding support for OpenID." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1414 msgid "external network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1417 msgid "A network segment typically used for instance Internet access." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1419 msgid "extra specs" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1422 msgid "" "Specifies additional requirements when Compute determines where to start a " "new instance. Examples include a minimum amount of network bandwidth or a " "GPU." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1425 msgid "FakeLDAP" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1428 msgid "" "An easy method to create a local LDAP directory for testing Identity and " "Compute. Requires Redis." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1430 msgid "fan-out exchange" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1433 msgid "" "Within RabbitMQ and Compute, it is the messaging interface that is used by " "the scheduler service to receive capability messages from the compute, " "volume, and network nodes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1436 msgid "federated identity" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1439 msgid "" "A method to establish trusts between identity providers and the OpenStack " "cloud." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1441 msgid "Fedora" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1444 msgid "A Linux distribution compatible with OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1445 msgid "Fibre Channel" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1448 msgid "" "Storage protocol similar in concept to TCP/IP; encapsulates SCSI commands " "and data." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1450 msgid "Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1453 msgid "The fibre channel protocol tunneled within Ethernet." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1454 msgid "fill-first scheduler" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1457 msgid "" "The Compute scheduling method that attempts to fill a host with VMs rather " "than starting new VMs on a variety of hosts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1459 msgid "filter" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1462 msgid "" "The step in the Compute scheduling process when hosts that cannot run VMs " "are eliminated and not chosen." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1464 msgid "firewall" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1467 msgid "" "Used to restrict communications between hosts and/or nodes, implemented in " "Compute using iptables, arptables, ip6tables, and ebtables." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1470 msgid "FWaaS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1473 msgid "A Networking extension that provides perimeter firewall functionality." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1475 msgid "fixed IP address" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1478 msgid "" "An IP address that is associated with the same instance each time that " "instance boots, is generally not accessible to end users or the public " "Internet, and is used for management of the instance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1482 msgid "Flat Manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1485 msgid "" "The Compute component that gives IP addresses to authorized nodes and " "assumes DHCP, DNS, and routing configuration and services are provided by " "something else." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1488 msgid "flat mode injection" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1491 msgid "" "A Compute networking method where the OS network configuration information " "is injected into the VM image before the instance starts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1494 msgid "flat network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1497 msgid "" "Virtual network type that uses neither VLANs nor tunnels to segregate tenant " "traffic. Each flat network typically requires a separate underlying physical " "interface defined by bridge mappings. However, a flat network can contain " "multiple subnets." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1502 msgid "FlatDHCP Manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1505 msgid "" "The Compute component that provides dnsmasq (DHCP, DNS, BOOTP, TFTP) and " "radvd (routing) services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1507 msgid "flavor" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1510 msgid "Alternative term for a VM instance type." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1511 msgid "flavor ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1514 msgid "UUID for each Compute or Image service VM flavor or instance type." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1516 msgid "floating IP address" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1519 msgid "" "An IP address that a project can associate with a VM so that the instance " "has the same public IP address each time that it boots. You create a pool of " "floating IP addresses and assign them to instances as they are launched to " "maintain a consistent IP address for maintaining DNS assignment." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1524 msgid "Folsom" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1527 msgid "" "A grouped release of projects related to OpenStack that came out in the fall " "of 2012, the sixth release of OpenStack. It includes Compute (nova), Object " "Storage (swift), Identity (keystone), Networking (neutron), Image service " "(glance), and Volumes or Block Storage (cinder). Folsom is the code name for " "the sixth release of OpenStack. The design summit took place in San " "Francisco, California, US and Folsom is a nearby city." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1535 msgid "FormPost" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1538 msgid "" "Object Storage middleware that uploads (posts) an image through a form on a " "web page." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1540 msgid "freezer" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1543 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides backup restore and disaster recovery as a " "service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1545 msgid "front end" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1548 msgid "" "The point where a user interacts with a service; can be an API endpoint, the " "horizon dashboard, or a command-line tool." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1550 msgid "gateway" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1553 msgid "" "An IP address, typically assigned to a router, that passes network traffic " "between different networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1555 msgid "generic receive offload (GRO)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1558 msgid "" "Feature of certain network interface drivers that combines many smaller " "received packets into a large packet before delivery to the kernel IP stack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1561 msgid "generic routing encapsulation (GRE)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1564 msgid "" "Protocol that encapsulates a wide variety of network layer protocols inside " "virtual point-to-point links." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1569 msgid "A core project that provides the OpenStack Image service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1570 msgid "glance API server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1573 msgid "" "Processes client requests for VMs, updates Image service metadata on the " "registry server, and communicates with the store adapter to upload VM images " "from the back-end store." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1576 msgid "glance registry" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1579 msgid "Alternative term for the Image service image registry." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1580 msgid "global endpoint template" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1583 msgid "" "The Identity service endpoint template that contains services available to " "all tenants." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1585 msgid "GlusterFS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1588 msgid "" "A file system designed to aggregate NAS hosts, compatible with OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1590 msgid "golden image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1593 msgid "" "A method of operating system installation where a finalized disk image is " "created and then used by all nodes without modification." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1596 msgid "Governance service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1599 msgid "" "OpenStack project to provide Governance-as-a-Service across any collection " "of cloud services in order to monitor, enforce, and audit policy over " "dynamic infrastructure. The code name for the project is congress." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1603 msgid "Graphic Interchange Format (GIF)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1606 msgid "" "A type of image file that is commonly used for animated images on web pages." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1608 msgid "Graphics Processing Unit (GPU)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1611 msgid "" "Choosing a host based on the existence of a GPU is currently unsupported in " "OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1613 msgid "Green Threads" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1616 msgid "" "The cooperative threading model used by Python; reduces race conditions and " "only context switches when specific library calls are made. Each OpenStack " "service is its own thread." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1619 msgid "Grizzly" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1622 msgid "" "The code name for the seventh release of OpenStack. The design summit took " "place in San Diego, California, US and Grizzly is an element of the state " "flag of California." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1626 msgid "Group" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1629 msgid "" "An Identity v3 API entity. Represents a collection of users that is owned by " "a specific domain." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1631 msgid "guest OS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1634 msgid "An operating system instance running under the control of a hypervisor." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1636 msgid "Hadoop" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1639 msgid "" "Apache Hadoop is an open source software framework that supports data-" "intensive distributed applications." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1641 msgid "Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1644 msgid "" "A distributed, highly fault-tolerant file system designed to run on low-cost " "commodity hardware." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1646 msgid "handover" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1649 msgid "" "An object state in Object Storage where a new replica of the object is " "automatically created due to a drive failure." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1651 msgid "hard reboot" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1654 msgid "" "A type of reboot where a physical or virtual power button is pressed as " "opposed to a graceful, proper shutdown of the operating system." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1657 msgid "Havana" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1660 msgid "" "The code name for the eighth release of OpenStack. The design summit took " "place in Portland, Oregon, US and Havana is an unincorporated community in " "Oregon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1666 msgid "" "An integrated project that aims to orchestrate multiple cloud applications " "for OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1668 msgid "Heat Orchestration Template (HOT)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1671 msgid "Heat input in the format native to OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1672 msgid "health monitor" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1675 msgid "" "Determines whether back-end members of a VIP pool can process a request. A " "pool can have several health monitors associated with it. When a pool has " "several monitors associated with it, all monitors check each member of the " "pool. All monitors must declare a member to be healthy for it to stay active." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1681 msgid "high availability (HA)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1684 msgid "" "A high availability system design approach and associated service " "implementation ensures that a prearranged level of operational performance " "will be met during a contractual measurement period. High availability " "systems seeks to minimize system downtime and data loss." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1689 msgid "horizon" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1692 msgid "OpenStack project that provides a dashboard, which is a web interface." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1694 msgid "horizon plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1697 msgid "A plug-in for the OpenStack dashboard (horizon)." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1698 msgid "host" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1701 msgid "A physical computer, not a VM instance (node)." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1702 msgid "host aggregate" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1705 msgid "" "A method to further subdivide availability zones into hypervisor pools, a " "collection of common hosts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1707 msgid "Host Bus Adapter (HBA)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1710 msgid "" "Device plugged into a PCI slot, such as a fibre channel or network card." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1712 msgid "hybrid cloud" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1715 msgid "" "A hybrid cloud is a composition of two or more clouds (private, community or " "public) that remain distinct entities but are bound together, offering the " "benefits of multiple deployment models. Hybrid cloud can also mean the " "ability to connect colocation, managed and/or dedicated services with cloud " "resources." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1721 msgid "Hyper-V" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1724 msgid "One of the hypervisors supported by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1725 msgid "hyperlink" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1728 msgid "" "Any kind of text that contains a link to some other site, commonly found in " "documents where clicking on a word or words opens up a different website." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1731 msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1734 msgid "" "An application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia " "information systems. It is the foundation of data communication for the " "World Wide Web. Hypertext is structured text that uses logical links " "(hyperlinks) between nodes containing text. HTTP is the protocol to exchange " "or transfer hypertext." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1739 msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1742 msgid "" "An encrypted communications protocol for secure communication over a " "computer network, with especially wide deployment on the Internet. " "Technically, it is not a protocol in and of itself; rather, it is the result " "of simply layering the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) on top of the TLS " "or SSL protocol, thus adding the security capabilities of TLS or SSL to " "standard HTTP communications. most OpenStack API endpoints and many inter-" "component communications support HTTPS communication." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1750 msgid "hypervisor" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1753 msgid "" "Software that arbitrates and controls VM access to the actual underlying " "hardware." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1755 msgid "hypervisor pool" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1758 msgid "A collection of hypervisors grouped together through host aggregates." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1760 msgid "IaaS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1763 msgid "" "Infrastructure-as-a-Service. IaaS is a provisioning model in which an " "organization outsources physical components of a data center, such as " "storage, hardware, servers, and networking components. A service provider " "owns the equipment and is responsible for housing, operating and maintaining " "it. The client typically pays on a per-use basis. IaaS is a model for " "providing cloud services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1769 msgid "Icehouse" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1772 msgid "" "The code name for the ninth release of OpenStack. The design summit took " "place in Hong Kong and Ice House is a street in that city." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1775 msgid "ICMP" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1778 msgid "" "Internet Control Message Protocol, used by network devices for control " "messages. For example, :command:`ping` uses ICMP to test connectivity." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1782 msgid "ID number" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1785 msgid "" "Unique numeric ID associated with each user in Identity, conceptually " "similar to a Linux or LDAP UID." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1787 msgid "Identity API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1790 msgid "Alternative term for the Identity service API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1791 msgid "Identity back end" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1794 msgid "" "The source used by Identity service to retrieve user information; an " "OpenLDAP server, for example." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1796 msgid "identity provider" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1799 msgid "" "A directory service, which allows users to login with a user name and " "password. It is a typical source of authentication tokens." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1805 msgid "" "The OpenStack core project that provides a central directory of users mapped " "to the OpenStack services they can access. It also registers endpoints for " "OpenStack services. It acts as a common authentication system. The project " "name of Identity is keystone." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1810 msgid "Identity service API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1813 msgid "" "The API used to access the OpenStack Identity service provided through " "keystone." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1815 msgid "IDS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1818 msgid "Intrusion Detection System." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1819 msgid "image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1822 msgid "" "A collection of files for a specific operating system (OS) that you use to " "create or rebuild a server. OpenStack provides pre-built images. You can " "also create custom images, or snapshots, from servers that you have " "launched. Custom images can be used for data backups or as "gold" images " "for additional servers." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1827 msgid "Image API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1830 msgid "The Image service API endpoint for management of VM images." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1832 msgid "image cache" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1835 msgid "" "Used by Image service to obtain images on the local host rather than re-" "downloading them from the image server each time one is requested." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1838 msgid "image ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1841 msgid "" "Combination of a URI and UUID used to access Image service VM images through " "the image API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1843 msgid "image membership" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1846 ../common/glossary.rst:2268 msgid "" "A list of tenants that can access a given VM image within Image service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1848 msgid "image owner" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1851 msgid "The tenant who owns an Image service virtual machine image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1853 msgid "image registry" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1856 msgid "A list of VM images that are available through Image service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1861 msgid "" "An OpenStack core project that provides discovery, registration, and " "delivery services for disk and server images. The project name of the Image " "service is glance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1864 msgid "Image service API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1867 msgid "Alternative name for the glance image API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1868 msgid "image status" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1871 msgid "" "The current status of a VM image in Image service, not to be confused with " "the status of a running instance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1873 msgid "image store" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1876 msgid "" "The back-end store used by Image service to store VM images, options include " "Object Storage, local file system, S3, or HTTP." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1878 msgid "image UUID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1881 msgid "UUID used by Image service to uniquely identify each VM image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1883 msgid "incubated project" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1886 msgid "" "A community project may be elevated to this status and is then promoted to a " "core project." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1888 msgid "ingress filtering" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1891 msgid "" "The process of filtering incoming network traffic. Supported by Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1893 msgid "INI" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1896 msgid "" "The OpenStack configuration files use an INI format to describe options and " "their values. It consists of sections and key value pairs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1899 msgid "injection" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1902 msgid "" "The process of putting a file into a virtual machine image before the " "instance is started." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1904 msgid "instance" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1907 msgid "" "A running VM, or a VM in a known state such as suspended, that can be used " "like a hardware server." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1909 msgid "instance ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1912 msgid "Alternative term for instance UUID." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1913 msgid "instance state" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1916 msgid "The current state of a guest VM image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1917 msgid "instance tunnels network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1920 msgid "" "A network segment used for instance traffic tunnels between compute nodes " "and the network node." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1922 msgid "instance type" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1925 msgid "" "Describes the parameters of the various virtual machine images that are " "available to users; includes parameters such as CPU, storage, and memory. " "Alternative term for flavor." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1928 msgid "instance type ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1931 msgid "Alternative term for a flavor ID." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1932 msgid "instance UUID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1935 ../common/glossary.rst:3247 msgid "Unique ID assigned to each guest VM instance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1936 msgid "interface" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1939 msgid "" "A physical or virtual device that provides connectivity to another device or " "medium." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1941 msgid "interface ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1944 msgid "Unique ID for a Networking VIF or vNIC in the form of a UUID." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1946 msgid "Internet protocol (IP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1949 msgid "" "Principal communications protocol in the internet protocol suite for " "relaying datagrams across network boundaries." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1951 msgid "Internet Service Provider (ISP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1954 msgid "" "Any business that provides Internet access to individuals or businesses." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1956 msgid "Internet Small Computer System Interface (iSCSI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1959 msgid "" "Storage protocol that encapsulates SCSI frames for transport over IP " "networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1964 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provisions bare metal, as opposed to virtual, " "machines." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1966 msgid "IOPS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1969 msgid "" "IOPS (Input/Output Operations Per Second) are a common performance " "measurement used to benchmark computer storage devices like hard disk " "drives, solid state drives, and storage area networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1973 msgid "IP address" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1976 msgid "" "Number that is unique to every computer system on the Internet. Two versions " "of the Internet Protocol (IP) are in use for addresses: IPv4 and IPv6." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1979 msgid "IP Address Management (IPAM)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1982 msgid "" "The process of automating IP address allocation, deallocation, and " "management. Currently provided by Compute, melange, and Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1985 msgid "IPL" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1988 msgid "Initial Program Loader." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1989 msgid "IPMI" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1992 msgid "" "Intelligent Platform Management Interface. IPMI is a standardized computer " "system interface used by system administrators for out-of-band management of " "computer systems and monitoring of their operation. In layman's terms, it is " "a way to manage a computer using a direct network connection, whether it is " "turned on or not; connecting to the hardware rather than an operating system " "or login shell." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:1999 msgid "ip6tables" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2002 msgid "" "Tool used to set up, maintain, and inspect the tables of IPv6 packet filter " "rules in the Linux kernel. In OpenStack Compute, ip6tables is used along " "with arptables, ebtables, and iptables to create firewalls for both nodes " "and VMs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2006 msgid "ipset" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2009 msgid "" "Extension to iptables that allows creation of firewall rules that match " "entire "sets" of IP addresses simultaneously.
