These sets reside in indexed " "data structures to increase efficiency, particularly on systems with a large " "quantity of rules." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2013 msgid "iptables" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2016 msgid "" "Used along with arptables and ebtables, iptables create firewalls in " "Compute. iptables are the tables provided by the Linux kernel firewall " "(implemented as different Netfilter modules) and the chains and rules it " "stores. Different kernel modules and programs are currently used for " "different protocols: iptables applies to IPv4, ip6tables to IPv6, arptables " "to ARP, and ebtables to Ethernet frames. Requires root privilege to " "manipulate." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2023 msgid "IQN" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2026 msgid "" "iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN) is the format most commonly used for iSCSI names, " "which uniquely identify nodes in an iSCSI network. All IQNs follow the " "pattern iqn.yyyy-mm.domain:identifier, where 'yyyy-mm' is the year and month " "in which the domain was registered, 'domain' is the reversed domain name of " "the issuing organization, and 'identifier' is an optional string which makes " "each IQN under the same domain unique. For example, 'iqn.2015-10.org." "openstack.408ae959bce1'." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2033 msgid "iSCSI" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2036 msgid "" "The SCSI disk protocol tunneled within Ethernet, supported by Compute, " "Object Storage, and Image service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2038 msgid "ISO9660" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2041 ../common/glossary.rst:2906 #: ../common/glossary.rst:3709 ../common/glossary.rst:3721 #: ../common/glossary.rst:3802 msgid "One of the VM image disk formats supported by Image service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2043 msgid "itsec" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2046 msgid "" "A default role in the Compute RBAC system that can quarantine an instance in " "any project." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2048 msgid "Java" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2051 msgid "" "A programming language that is used to create systems that involve more than " "one computer by way of a network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2053 msgid "JavaScript" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2056 msgid "A scripting language that is used to build web pages." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2057 msgid "JavaScript Object Notation (JSON)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2060 msgid "One of the supported response formats in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2061 msgid "Jenkins" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2064 msgid "Tool used to run jobs automatically for OpenStack development." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2066 msgid "jumbo frame" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2069 msgid "" "Feature in modern Ethernet networks that supports frames up to approximately " "9000 bytes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2071 msgid "Juno" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2074 msgid "" "The code name for the tenth release of OpenStack. The design summit took " "place in Atlanta, Georgia, US and Juno is an unincorporated community in " "Georgia." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2077 msgid "Kerberos" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2080 msgid "" "A network authentication protocol which works on the basis of tickets. " "Kerberos allows nodes communication over a non-secure network, and allows " "nodes to prove their identity to one another in a secure manner." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2084 msgid "kernel-based VM (KVM)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2087 msgid "" "An OpenStack-supported hypervisor. KVM is a full virtualization solution for " "Linux on x86 hardware containing virtualization extensions (Intel VT or AMD-" "V), ARM, IBM Power, and IBM zSeries. It consists of a loadable kernel " "module, that provides the core virtualization infrastructure and a processor " "specific module." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2096 msgid "" "OpenStack project that produces a secret storage and generation system " "capable of providing key management for services wishing to enable " "encryption features. The code name of the project is barbican." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2103 msgid "The project that provides OpenStack Identity services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2104 msgid "Kickstart" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2107 msgid "" "A tool to automate system configuration and installation on Red Hat, Fedora, " "and CentOS-based Linux distributions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2109 msgid "Kilo" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2112 msgid "" "The code name for the eleventh release of OpenStack. The design summit took " "place in Paris, France. Due to delays in the name selection, the release was " "known only as K. Because ``k`` is the unit symbol for kilo and the reference " "artifact is stored near Paris in the Pavillon de Breteuil in Sèvres, the " "community chose Kilo as the release name." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2118 msgid "large object" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2121 msgid "An object within Object Storage that is larger than 5 GB." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2122 msgid "Launchpad" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2125 msgid "The collaboration site for OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2126 msgid "Layer-2 network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2129 msgid "" "Term used in the OSI network architecture for the data link layer. The data " "link layer is responsible for media access control, flow control and " "detecting and possibly correcting errors that may occur in the physical " "layer." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2133 msgid "Layer-3 network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2136 msgid "" "Term used in the OSI network architecture for the network layer. The network " "layer is responsible for packet forwarding including routing from one node " "to another." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2139 msgid "Layer-2 (L2) agent" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2142 msgid "" "OpenStack Networking agent that provides layer-2 connectivity for virtual " "networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2144 msgid "Layer-3 (L3) agent" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2147 msgid "" "OpenStack Networking agent that provides layer-3 (routing) services for " "virtual networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2149 msgid "Liberty" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2152 msgid "" "The code name for the twelfth release of OpenStack. The design summit took " "place in Vancouver, Canada and Liberty is the name of a village in the " "Canadian province of Saskatchewan." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2156 msgid "libvirt" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2159 msgid "" "Virtualization API library used by OpenStack to interact with many of its " "supported hypervisors." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2161 msgid "Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2164 msgid "" "An application protocol for accessing and maintaining distributed directory " "information services over an IP network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2166 msgid "Linux bridge" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2169 msgid "" "Software that enables multiple VMs to share a single physical NIC within " "Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2171 msgid "Linux Bridge neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2174 msgid "" "Enables a Linux bridge to understand a Networking port, interface " "attachment, and other abstractions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2176 msgid "Linux containers (LXC)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2180 msgid "live migration" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2183 msgid "" "The ability within Compute to move running virtual machine instances from " "one host to another with only a small service interruption during switchover." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2186 msgid "load balancer" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2189 msgid "" "A load balancer is a logical device that belongs to a cloud account. It is " "used to distribute workloads between multiple back-end systems or services, " "based on the criteria defined as part of its configuration." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2193 msgid "load balancing" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2196 msgid "" "The process of spreading client requests between two or more nodes to " "improve performance and availability." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2198 msgid "LBaaS" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2201 msgid "" "Enables Networking to distribute incoming requests evenly between designated " "instances." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2203 msgid "Logical Volume Manager (LVM)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2206 msgid "" "Provides a method of allocating space on mass-storage devices that is more " "flexible than conventional partitioning schemes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2212 msgid "" "Code name for the OpenStack project that provides the Containers Service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2214 msgid "management API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2217 msgid "Alternative term for an admin API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2218 msgid "management network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2221 msgid "" "A network segment used for administration, not accessible to the public " "Internet." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2223 msgid "manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2226 msgid "" "Logical groupings of related code, such as the Block Storage volume manager " "or network manager." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2228 msgid "manifest" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2231 msgid "Used to track segments of a large object within Object Storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2233 msgid "manifest object" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2236 msgid "" "A special Object Storage object that contains the manifest for a large " "object." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2241 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides shared file systems as service to " "applications." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2243 msgid "maximum transmission unit (MTU)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2246 msgid "" "Maximum frame or packet size for a particular network medium. Typically 1500 " "bytes for Ethernet networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2248 msgid "mechanism driver" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2251 msgid "" "A driver for the Modular Layer 2 (ML2) neutron plug-in that provides layer-2 " "connectivity for virtual instances. A single OpenStack installation can use " "multiple mechanism drivers." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2255 msgid "melange" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2258 msgid "" "Project name for OpenStack Network Information Service. To be merged with " "Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2260 msgid "membership" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2263 msgid "" "The association between an Image service VM image and a tenant. Enables " "images to be shared with specified tenants." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2265 msgid "membership list" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2270 msgid "memcached" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2273 msgid "" "A distributed memory object caching system that is used by Object Storage " "for caching." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2275 msgid "memory overcommit" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2278 msgid "" "The ability to start new VM instances based on the actual memory usage of a " "host, as opposed to basing the decision on the amount of RAM each running " "instance thinks it has available. Also known as RAM overcommit." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2282 msgid "message broker" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2285 msgid "" "The software package used to provide AMQP messaging capabilities within " "Compute. Default package is RabbitMQ." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2287 msgid "message bus" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2290 msgid "" "The main virtual communication line used by all AMQP messages for inter-" "cloud communications within Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2292 msgid "message queue" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2295 msgid "" "Passes requests from clients to the appropriate workers and returns the " "output to the client after the job completes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2297 msgid "Message service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2300 msgid "" "OpenStack project that aims to produce an OpenStack messaging service that " "affords a variety of distributed application patterns in an efficient, " "scalable and highly-available manner, and to create and maintain associated " "Python libraries and documentation. The code name for the project is zaqar." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2306 msgid "Metadata agent" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2309 msgid "" "OpenStack Networking agent that provides metadata services for instances." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2311 msgid "Meta-Data Server (MDS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2314 msgid "Stores CephFS metadata." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2315 msgid "migration" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2318 msgid "The process of moving a VM instance from one host to another." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2323 msgid "OpenStack project that provides the Workflow service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2324 msgid "Mitaka" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2327 msgid "" "The code name for the thirteenth release of OpenStack. The design summit " "took place in Tokyo, Japan. Mitaka is a city in Tokyo." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2333 msgid "OpenStack project that provides a Monitoring service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2334 msgid "multi-host" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2337 msgid "" "High-availability mode for legacy (nova) networking. Each compute node " "handles NAT and DHCP and acts as a gateway for all of the VMs on it. A " "networking failure on one compute node doesn't affect VMs on other compute " "nodes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2341 msgid "multinic" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2344 msgid "" "Facility in Compute that allows each virtual machine instance to have more " "than one VIF connected to it." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2349 msgid "OpenStack project that provides an Application catalog." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2350 msgid "Modular Layer 2 (ML2) neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2353 msgid "" "Can concurrently use multiple layer-2 networking technologies, such as " "802.1Q and VXLAN, in Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2355 msgid "Monitor (LBaaS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2358 msgid "" "LBaaS feature that provides availability monitoring using the ``ping`` " "command, TCP, and HTTP/HTTPS GET." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2360 msgid "Monitor (Mon)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2363 msgid "" "A Ceph component that communicates with external clients, checks data state " "and consistency, and performs quorum functions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2368 msgid "" "The OpenStack project that provides a multi-tenant, highly scalable, " "performant, fault-tolerant Monitoring-as-a-Service solution for metrics, " "complex event processing, and logging. It builds an extensible platform for " "advanced monitoring services that can be used by both operators and tenants " "to gain operational insight and visibility, ensuring availability and " "stability. The project name is monasca." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2375 msgid "multi-factor authentication" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2378 msgid "" "Authentication method that uses two or more credentials, such as a password " "and a private key. Currently not supported in Identity." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2381 msgid "MultiNic" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2384 msgid "" "Facility in Compute that enables a virtual machine instance to have more " "than one VIF connected to it." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2386 msgid "Nebula" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2389 msgid "Released as open source by NASA in 2010 and is the basis for Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2391 msgid "netadmin" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2394 msgid "" "One of the default roles in the Compute RBAC system. Enables the user to " "allocate publicly accessible IP addresses to instances and change firewall " "rules." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2397 msgid "NetApp volume driver" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2400 msgid "" "Enables Compute to communicate with NetApp storage devices through the " "NetApp OnCommand Provisioning Manager." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2403 msgid "network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2406 msgid "" "A virtual network that provides connectivity between entities. For example, " "a collection of virtual ports that share network connectivity. In Networking " "terminology, a network is always a layer-2 network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2410 msgid "NAT" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2413 msgid "" "Network Address Translation; Process of modifying IP address information " "while in transit. Supported by Compute and Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2416 msgid "network controller" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2419 msgid "" "A Compute daemon that orchestrates the network configuration of nodes, " "including IP addresses, VLANs, and bridging. Also manages routing for both " "public and private networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2422 msgid "Network File System (NFS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2425 msgid "" "A method for making file systems available over the network. Supported by " "OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2427 msgid "network ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2430 msgid "" "Unique ID assigned to each network segment within Networking. Same as " "network UUID." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2432 msgid "network manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2435 msgid "" "The Compute component that manages various network components, such as " "firewall rules, IP address allocation, and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2437 msgid "network namespace" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2440 msgid "" "Linux kernel feature that provides independent virtual networking instances " "on a single host with separate routing tables and interfaces. Similar to " "virtual routing and forwarding (VRF) services on physical network equipment." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2444 msgid "network node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2447 msgid "Any compute node that runs the network worker daemon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2448 msgid "network segment" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2451 msgid "Represents a virtual, isolated OSI layer-2 subnet in Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2453 msgid "Newton" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2456 msgid "" "The code name for the fourteenth release of OpenStack. The design summit " "took place in Austin, Texas, US. The release is named after "Newton House" " "which is located at 1013 E. Ninth St., Austin, TX. which is listed on the " "National Register of Historic Places." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2461 msgid "NTP" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2464 msgid "" "Network Time Protocol; Method of keeping a clock for a host or node correct " "via communication with a trusted, accurate time source." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2467 msgid "network UUID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2470 msgid "Unique ID for a Networking network segment." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2471 msgid "network worker" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2474 msgid "" "The ``nova-network`` worker daemon; provides services such as giving an IP " "address to a booting nova instance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2480 msgid "" "A core OpenStack project that provides a network connectivity abstraction " "layer to OpenStack Compute. The project name of Networking is neutron." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2483 msgid "Networking API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2486 msgid "" "API used to access OpenStack Networking. Provides an extensible architecture " "to enable custom plug-in creation." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2491 msgid "" "A core OpenStack project that provides a network connectivity abstraction " "layer to OpenStack Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2493 msgid "neutron API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2496 msgid "An alternative name for Networking API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2497 msgid "neutron manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2500 msgid "" "Enables Compute and Networking integration, which enables Networking to " "perform network management for guest VMs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2502 msgid "neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2505 msgid "" "Interface within Networking that enables organizations to create custom plug-" "ins for advanced features, such as QoS, ACLs, or IDS." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2508 msgid "Nexenta volume driver" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2511 msgid "Provides support for NexentaStor devices in Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2512 msgid "No ACK" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2515 msgid "" "Disables server-side message acknowledgment in the Compute RabbitMQ. " "Increases performance but decreases reliability." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2517 msgid "node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2520 msgid "A VM instance that runs on a host." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2521 msgid "non-durable exchange" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2524 msgid "" "Message exchange that is cleared when the service restarts. Its data is not " "written to persistent storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2526 msgid "non-durable queue" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2529 msgid "" "Message queue that is cleared when the service restarts. Its data is not " "written to persistent storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2531 msgid "non-persistent volume" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2534 msgid "Alternative term for an ephemeral volume." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2535 msgid "north-south traffic" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2538 msgid "" "Network traffic between a user or client (north) and a server (south), or " "traffic into the cloud (south) and out of the cloud (north). See also east-" "west traffic." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2544 msgid "OpenStack project that provides compute services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2545 msgid "Nova API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2548 msgid "Alternative term for the Compute API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2549 msgid "nova-network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2552 msgid "" "A Compute component that manages IP address allocation, firewalls, and other " "network-related tasks. This is the legacy networking option and an " "alternative to Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2555 msgid "object" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2558 msgid "A BLOB of data held by Object Storage; can be in any format." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2560 msgid "object auditor" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2563 msgid "" "Opens all objects for an object server and verifies the MD5 hash, size, and " "metadata for each object." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2565 msgid "object expiration" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2568 msgid "" "A configurable option within Object Storage to automatically delete objects " "after a specified amount of time has passed or a certain date is reached." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2571 msgid "object hash" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2574 msgid "Uniquely ID for an Object Storage object." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2575 msgid "object path hash" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2578 msgid "" "Used by Object Storage to determine the location of an object in the ring. " "Maps objects to partitions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2580 msgid "object replicator" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2583 msgid "" "An Object Storage component that copies an object to remote partitions for " "fault tolerance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2585 msgid "object server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2588 msgid "An Object Storage component that is responsible for managing objects." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2593 msgid "" "The OpenStack core project that provides eventually consistent and redundant " "storage and retrieval of fixed digital content. The project name of " "OpenStack Object Storage is swift." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2596 msgid "Object Storage API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2599 msgid "API used to access OpenStack Object Storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2600 msgid "Object Storage Device (OSD)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2603 msgid "The Ceph storage daemon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2604 msgid "object versioning" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2607 msgid "" "Allows a user to set a flag on an Object Storage container so that all " "objects within the container are versioned." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2609 msgid "Ocata" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2612 msgid "" "The code name for the fifteenth release of OpenStack. The design summit will " "take place in Barcelona, Spain. Ocata is a beach north of Barcelona." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2615 msgid "Oldie" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2618 msgid "" "Term for an Object Storage process that runs for a long time. Can indicate a " "hung process." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2620 msgid "Open Cloud Computing Interface (OCCI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2623 msgid "" "A standardized interface for managing compute, data, and network resources, " "currently unsupported in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2625 msgid "Open Virtualization Format (OVF)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2628 msgid "Standard for packaging VM images. Supported in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2629 msgid "Open vSwitch" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2632 msgid "" "Open vSwitch is a production quality, multilayer virtual switch licensed " "under the open source Apache 2.0 license. It is designed to enable massive " "network automation through programmatic extension, while still supporting " "standard management interfaces and protocols (for example NetFlow, sFlow, " "SPAN, RSPAN, CLI, LACP, 802.1ag)." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2638 msgid "Open vSwitch (OVS) agent" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2641 msgid "" "Provides an interface to the underlying Open vSwitch service for the " "Networking plug-in." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2643 msgid "Open vSwitch neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2646 msgid "Provides support for Open vSwitch in Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2647 msgid "OpenLDAP" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2650 msgid "An open source LDAP server. Supported by both Compute and Identity." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2652 msgid "OpenStack" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2655 msgid "" "OpenStack is a cloud operating system that controls large pools of compute, " "storage, and networking resources throughout a data center, all managed " "through a dashboard that gives administrators control while empowering their " "users to provision resources through a web interface. OpenStack is an open " "source project licensed under the Apache License 2.0." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2661 msgid "OpenStack code name" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2664 msgid "" "Each OpenStack release has a code name. Code names ascend in alphabetical " "order: Austin, Bexar, Cactus, Diablo, Essex, Folsom, Grizzly, Havana, " "Icehouse, Juno, Kilo, Liberty, and Mitaka. Code names are cities or counties " "near where the corresponding OpenStack design summit took place. An " "exception, called the Waldon exception, is granted to elements of the state " "flag that sound especially cool. Code names are chosen by popular vote." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2673 msgid "openSUSE" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2677 msgid "operator" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2680 msgid "" "The person responsible for planning and maintaining an OpenStack " "installation." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2682 msgid "optional service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2685 msgid "" "An official OpenStack service defined as optional by DefCore Committee. " "Currently, consists of Dashboard (horizon), Telemetry service (Telemetry), " "Orchestration service (heat), Database service (trove), Bare Metal service " "(ironic), and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2693 msgid "" "An integrated project that orchestrates multiple cloud applications for " "OpenStack. The project name of Orchestration is heat." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2696 msgid "orphan" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2699 msgid "" "In the context of Object Storage, this is a process that is not terminated " "after an upgrade, restart, or reload of the service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2701 msgid "Oslo" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2704 msgid "" "OpenStack project that produces a set of Python libraries containing code " "shared by OpenStack projects." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2706 msgid "parent cell" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2709 msgid "" "If a requested resource, such as CPU time, disk storage, or memory, is not " "available in the parent cell, the request is forwarded to associated child " "cells." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2712 msgid "partition" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2715 msgid "" "A unit of storage within Object Storage used to store objects. It exists on " "top of devices and is replicated for fault tolerance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2718 msgid "partition index" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2721 msgid "" "Contains the locations of all Object Storage partitions within the ring." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2723 msgid "partition shift value" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2726 msgid "" "Used by Object Storage to determine which partition data should reside on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2728 msgid "path MTU discovery (PMTUD)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2731 msgid "" "Mechanism in IP networks to detect end-to-end MTU and adjust packet size " "accordingly." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2733 msgid "pause" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2736 msgid "" "A VM state where no changes occur (no changes in memory, network " "communications stop, etc); the VM is frozen but not shut down." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2738 msgid "PCI passthrough" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2741 msgid "" "Gives guest VMs exclusive access to a PCI device. Currently supported in " "OpenStack Havana and later releases." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2743 msgid "persistent message" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2746 msgid "" "A message that is stored both in memory and on disk. The message is not lost " "after a failure or restart." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2748 msgid "persistent volume" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2751 msgid "Changes to these types of disk volumes are saved." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2752 msgid "personality file" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2755 msgid "" "A file used to customize a Compute instance. It can be used to inject SSH " "keys or a specific network configuration." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2757 msgid "Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2760 msgid "" "Provides to the consumer the ability to deploy applications through a " "programming language or tools supported by the cloud platform provider. An " "example of Platform-as-a-Service is an Eclipse/Java programming platform " "provided with no downloads required." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2765 msgid "plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2768 msgid "" "Software component providing the actual implementation for Networking APIs, " "or for Compute APIs, depending on the context." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2770 msgid "policy service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2773 msgid "" "Component of Identity that provides a rule-management interface and a rule-" "based authorization engine." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2775 msgid "pool" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2778 msgid "" "A logical set of devices, such as web servers, that you group together to " "receive and process traffic. The load balancing function chooses which " "member of the pool handles the new requests or connections received on the " "VIP address. Each VIP has one pool." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2783 msgid "pool member" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2786 msgid "" "An application that runs on the back-end server in a load-balancing system." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2788 msgid "port" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2791 msgid "" "A virtual network port within Networking; VIFs / vNICs are connected to a " "port." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2793 msgid "port UUID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2796 msgid "Unique ID for a Networking port." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2797 msgid "preseed" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2800 msgid "" "A tool to automate system configuration and installation on Debian-based " "Linux distributions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2802 msgid "private image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2805 msgid "An Image service VM image that is only available to specified tenants." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2807 msgid "private IP address" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2810 msgid "" "An IP address used for management and administration, not available to the " "public Internet." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2812 msgid "private network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2815 msgid "" "The Network Controller provides virtual networks to enable compute servers " "to interact with each other and with the public network. All machines must " "have a public and private network interface. A private network interface can " "be a flat or VLAN network interface. A flat network interface is controlled " "by the flat_interface with flat managers. A VLAN network interface is " "controlled by the ``vlan_interface`` option with VLAN managers." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2823 msgid "project" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2826 msgid "" "Projects represent the base unit of “ownership” in OpenStack, in that all " "resources in OpenStack should be owned by a specific project. In OpenStack " "Identity, a project must be owned by a specific domain." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2829 msgid "project ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2832 msgid "User-defined alphanumeric string in Compute; the name of a project." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2834 msgid "project VPN" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2837 msgid "Alternative term for a cloudpipe." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2838 msgid "promiscuous mode" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2841 msgid "" "Causes the network interface to pass all traffic it receives to the host " "rather than passing only the frames addressed to it." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2844 msgid "protected property" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2847 msgid "" "Generally, extra properties on an Image service image to which only cloud " "administrators have access. Limits which user roles can perform CRUD " "operations on that property. The cloud administrator can configure any image " "property as protected." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2852 msgid "provider" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2855 msgid "An administrator who has access to all hosts and instances." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2857 msgid "proxy node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2860 msgid "A node that provides the Object Storage proxy service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2861 msgid "proxy server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2864 msgid "" "Users of Object Storage interact with the service through the proxy server, " "which in turn looks up the location of the requested data within the ring " "and returns the results to the user." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2867 msgid "public API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2870 msgid "" "An API endpoint used for both service-to-service communication and end-user " "interactions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2872 msgid "public image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2875 msgid "An Image service VM image that is available to all tenants." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2877 msgid "public IP address" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2880 msgid "An IP address that is accessible to end-users." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2881 msgid "public key authentication" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2884 msgid "Authentication method that uses keys rather than passwords." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2886 msgid "public network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2889 msgid "" "The Network Controller provides virtual networks to enable compute servers " "to interact with each other and with the public network. All machines must " "have a public and private network interface. The public network interface is " "controlled by the ``public_interface`` option." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2894 msgid "Puppet" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2897 msgid "" "An operating system configuration-management tool supported by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2899 msgid "Python" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2902 msgid "Programming language used extensively in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2903 msgid "QEMU Copy On Write 2 (QCOW2)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2908 msgid "Qpid" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2911 msgid "" "Message queue software supported by OpenStack; an alternative to RabbitMQ." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2913 msgid "quarantine" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2916 msgid "" "If Object Storage finds objects, containers, or accounts that are corrupt, " "they are placed in this state, are not replicated, cannot be read by " "clients, and a correct copy is re-replicated." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2919 msgid "Quick EMUlator (QEMU)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2922 msgid "" "QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer. One of " "the hypervisors supported by OpenStack, generally used for development " "purposes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2926 msgid "quota" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2929 msgid "" "In Compute and Block Storage, the ability to set resource limits on a per-" "project basis." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2931 msgid "RabbitMQ" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2934 msgid "The default message queue software used by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2935 msgid "Rackspace Cloud Files" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2938 msgid "" "Released as open source by Rackspace in 2010; the basis for Object Storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2940 msgid "RADOS Block Device (RBD)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2943 msgid "" "Ceph component that enables a Linux block device to be striped over multiple " "distributed data stores." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2945 msgid "radvd" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2948 msgid "" "The router advertisement daemon, used by the Compute VLAN manager and " "FlatDHCP manager to provide routing services for VM instances." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2951 msgid "rally" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2954 msgid "OpenStack project that provides the Benchmark service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2955 msgid "RAM filter" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2958 msgid "The Compute setting that enables or disables RAM overcommitment." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2960 msgid "RAM overcommit" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2963 msgid "" "The ability to start new VM instances based on the actual memory usage of a " "host, as opposed to basing the decision on the amount of RAM each running " "instance thinks it has available. Also known as memory overcommit." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2967 msgid "rate limit" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2970 msgid "" "Configurable option within Object Storage to limit database writes on a per-" "account and/or per-container basis." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2972 msgid "raw" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2975 msgid "" "One of the VM image disk formats supported by Image service; an unstructured " "disk image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2977 msgid "rebalance" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2980 msgid "" "The process of distributing Object Storage partitions across all drives in " "the ring; used during initial ring creation and after ring reconfiguration." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2983 msgid "reboot" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2986 msgid "" "Either a soft or hard reboot of a server. With a soft reboot, the operating " "system is signaled to restart, which enables a graceful shutdown of all " "processes. A hard reboot is the equivalent of power cycling the server. The " "virtualization platform should ensure that the reboot action has completed " "successfully, even in cases in which the underlying domain/VM is paused or " "halted/stopped." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2992 msgid "rebuild" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2995 msgid "" "Removes all data on the server and replaces it with the specified image. " "Server ID and IP addresses remain the same." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:2997 msgid "Recon" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3000 msgid "An Object Storage component that collects meters." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3001 msgid "record" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3004 msgid "" "Belongs to a particular domain and is used to specify information about the " "domain. There are several types of DNS records. Each record type contains " "particular information used to describe the purpose of that record. Examples " "include mail exchange (MX) records, which specify the mail server for a " "particular domain; and name server (NS) records, which specify the " "authoritative name servers for a domain." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3011 msgid "record ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3014 msgid "" "A number within a database that is incremented each time a change is made. " "Used by Object Storage when replicating." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3016 msgid "Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3020 msgid "reference architecture" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3023 msgid "A recommended architecture for an OpenStack cloud." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3024 msgid "region" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3027 msgid "" "A discrete OpenStack environment with dedicated API endpoints that typically " "shares only the Identity (keystone) with other regions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3030 msgid "registry" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3033 msgid "Alternative term for the Image service registry." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3034 msgid "registry server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3037 msgid "" "An Image service that provides VM image metadata information to clients." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3039 msgid "Reliable, Autonomic Distributed Object Store" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3041 msgid "(RADOS)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3043 msgid "" "A collection of components that provides object storage within Ceph. Similar " "to OpenStack Object Storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3045 msgid "Remote Procedure Call (RPC)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3048 msgid "" "The method used by the Compute RabbitMQ for intra-service communications." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3050 msgid "replica" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3053 msgid "" "Provides data redundancy and fault tolerance by creating copies of Object " "Storage objects, accounts, and containers so that they are not lost when the " "underlying storage fails." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3056 msgid "replica count" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3059 msgid "The number of replicas of the data in an Object Storage ring." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3061 msgid "replication" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3064 msgid "" "The process of copying data to a separate physical device for fault " "tolerance and performance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3066 msgid "replicator" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3069 msgid "" "The Object Storage back-end process that creates and manages object replicas." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3071 msgid "request ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3074 msgid "Unique ID assigned to each request sent to Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3075 msgid "rescue image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3078 msgid "" "A special type of VM image that is booted when an instance is placed into " "rescue mode. Allows an administrator to mount the file systems for an " "instance to correct the problem." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3081 msgid "resize" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3084 msgid "" "Converts an existing server to a different flavor, which scales the server " "up or down. The original server is saved to enable rollback if a problem " "occurs. All resizes must be tested and explicitly confirmed, at which time " "the original server is removed." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3088 msgid "RESTful" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3091 msgid "" "A kind of web service API that uses REST, or Representational State " "Transfer. REST is the style of architecture for hypermedia systems that is " "used for the World Wide Web." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3094 msgid "ring" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3097 msgid "" "An entity that maps Object Storage data to partitions. A separate ring " "exists for each service, such as account, object, and container." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3100 msgid "ring builder" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3103 msgid "" "Builds and manages rings within Object Storage, assigns partitions to " "devices, and pushes the configuration to other storage nodes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3106 msgid "Role Based Access Control (RBAC)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3109 msgid "" "Provides a predefined list of actions that the user can perform, such as " "start or stop VMs, reset passwords, and so on. Supported in both Identity " "and Compute and can be configured using the horizon dashboard." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3113 msgid "role" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3116 msgid "" "A personality that a user assumes to perform a specific set of operations. A " "role includes a set of rights and privileges. A user assuming that role " "inherits those rights and privileges." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3119 msgid "role ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3122 msgid "Alphanumeric ID assigned to each Identity service role." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3123 msgid "rootwrap" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3126 msgid "" "A feature of Compute that allows the unprivileged "nova" user to run a " "specified list of commands as the Linux root user." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3128 msgid "round-robin scheduler" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3131 msgid "" "Type of Compute scheduler that evenly distributes instances among available " "hosts." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3133 msgid "router" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3136 msgid "" "A physical or virtual network device that passes network traffic between " "different networks." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3138 msgid "routing key" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3141 msgid "" "The Compute direct exchanges, fanout exchanges, and topic exchanges use this " "key to determine how to process a message; processing varies depending on " "exchange type." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3144 msgid "RPC driver" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3147 msgid "" "Modular system that allows the underlying message queue software of Compute " "to be changed. For example, from RabbitMQ to ZeroMQ or Qpid." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3150 msgid "rsync" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3153 msgid "Used by Object Storage to push object replicas." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3154 msgid "RXTX cap" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3157 msgid "" "Absolute limit on the amount of network traffic a Compute VM instance can " "send and receive." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3159 msgid "RXTX quota" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3162 msgid "" "Soft limit on the amount of network traffic a Compute VM instance can send " "and receive." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3164 msgid "S3" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3167 msgid "" "Object storage service by Amazon; similar in function to Object Storage, it " "can act as a back-end store for Image service VM images." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3172 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides a scalable data-processing stack and " "associated management interfaces." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3174 msgid "SAML assertion" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3177 msgid "" "Contains information about a user as provided by the identity provider. It " "is an indication that a user has been authenticated." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3179 msgid "scheduler manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3182 msgid "" "A Compute component that determines where VM instances should start. Uses " "modular design to support a variety of scheduler types." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3185 msgid "scoped token" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3188 msgid "" "An Identity service API access token that is associated with a specific " "tenant." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3190 msgid "scrubber" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3193 msgid "" "Checks for and deletes unused VMs; the component of Image service that " "implements delayed delete." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3195 msgid "secret key" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3198 msgid "" "String of text known only by the user; used along with an access key to make " "requests to the Compute API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3200 msgid "secure shell (SSH)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3203 msgid "" "Open source tool used to access remote hosts through an encrypted " "communications channel, SSH key injection is supported by Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3206 msgid "security group" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3209 msgid "" "A set of network traffic filtering rules that are applied to a Compute " "instance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3211 msgid "segmented object" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3214 msgid "" "An Object Storage large object that has been broken up into pieces. The re-" "assembled object is called a concatenated object." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3217 msgid "self-service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3220 msgid "" "For IaaS, ability for a regular (non-privileged) account to manage a virtual " "infrastructure component such as networks without involving an administrator." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3223 msgid "SELinux" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3226 msgid "" "Linux kernel security module that provides the mechanism for supporting " "access control policies." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3231 msgid "OpenStack project that provides a Clustering service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3232 msgid "server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3235 msgid "" "Computer that provides explicit services to the client software running on " "that system, often managing a variety of computer operations. A server is a " "VM instance in the Compute system. Flavor and image are requisite elements " "when creating a server." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3240 msgid "server image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3243 msgid "Alternative term for a VM image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3244 msgid "server UUID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3248 msgid "service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3251 msgid "" "An OpenStack service, such as Compute, Object Storage, or Image service. " "Provides one or more endpoints through which users can access resources and " "perform operations." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3254 msgid "service catalog" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3257 msgid "Alternative term for the Identity service catalog." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3258 msgid "service ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3261 msgid "" "Unique ID assigned to each service that is available in the Identity service " "catalog." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3263 msgid "service provider" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3266 msgid "" "A system that provides services to other system entities. In case of " "federated identity, OpenStack Identity is the service provider." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3269 msgid "service registration" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3272 msgid "" "An Identity service feature that enables services, such as Compute, to " "automatically register with the catalog." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3274 msgid "service tenant" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3277 msgid "" "Special tenant that contains all services that are listed in the catalog." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3279 msgid "service token" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3282 msgid "" "An administrator-defined token used by Compute to communicate securely with " "the Identity service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3284 msgid "session back end" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3287 msgid "" "The method of storage used by horizon to track client sessions, such as " "local memory, cookies, a database, or memcached." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3289 msgid "session persistence" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3292 msgid "" "A feature of the load-balancing service. It attempts to force subsequent " "connections to a service to be redirected to the same node as long as it is " "online." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3295 msgid "session storage" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3298 msgid "" "A horizon component that stores and tracks client session information. " "Implemented through the Django sessions framework." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3300 msgid "share" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3303 msgid "" "A remote, mountable file system in the context of the Shared File Systems. " "You can mount a share to, and access a share from, several hosts by several " "users at a time." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3306 msgid "share network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3309 msgid "" "An entity in the context of the Shared File Systems that encapsulates " "interaction with the Networking service. If the driver you selected runs in " "the mode requiring such kind of interaction, you need to specify the share " "network to create a share." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3313 msgid "Shared File Systems API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3316 msgid "" "A Shared File Systems service that provides a stable RESTful API. The " "service authenticates and routes requests throughout the Shared File Systems " "service. There is python-manilaclient to interact with the API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3323 msgid "" "An OpenStack service that provides a set of services for management of " "shared file systems in a multi-tenant cloud environment. The service is " "similar to how OpenStack provides block-based storage management through the " "OpenStack Block Storage service project. With the Shared File Systems " "service, you can create a remote file system and mount the file system on " "your instances. You can also read and write data from your instances to and " "from your file system. The project name of the Shared File Systems service " "is manila." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3332 msgid "shared IP address" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3335 msgid "" "An IP address that can be assigned to a VM instance within the shared IP " "group. Public IP addresses can be shared across multiple servers for use in " "various high-availability scenarios. When an IP address is shared to another " "server, the cloud network restrictions are modified to enable each server to " "listen to and respond on that IP address. You can optionally specify that " "the target server network configuration be modified. Shared IP addresses can " "be used with many standard heartbeat facilities, such as keepalive, that " "monitor for failure and manage IP failover." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3344 msgid "shared IP group" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3347 msgid "" "A collection of servers that can share IPs with other members of the group. " "Any server in a group can share one or more public IPs with any other server " "in the group. With the exception of the first server in a shared IP group, " "servers must be launched into shared IP groups. A server may be a member of " "only one shared IP group." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3352 msgid "shared storage" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3355 msgid "" "Block storage that is simultaneously accessible by multiple clients, for " "example, NFS." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3357 msgid "Sheepdog" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3360 msgid "Distributed block storage system for QEMU, supported by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3362 msgid "Simple Cloud Identity Management (SCIM)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3365 msgid "" "Specification for managing identity in the cloud, currently unsupported by " "OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3367 msgid "Single-root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3370 msgid "" "A specification that, when implemented by a physical PCIe device, enables it " "to appear as multiple separate PCIe devices. This enables multiple " "virtualized guests to share direct access to the physical device, offering " "improved performance over an equivalent virtual device. Currently supported " "in OpenStack Havana and later releases." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3376 msgid "Service Level Agreement (SLA)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3379 msgid "Contractual obligations that ensure the availability of a service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3381 msgid "SmokeStack" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3384 msgid "Runs automated tests against the core OpenStack API; written in Rails." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3386 msgid "snapshot" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3389 msgid "" "A point-in-time copy of an OpenStack storage volume or image. Use storage " "volume snapshots to back up volumes. Use image snapshots to back up data, or " "as "gold" images for additional servers." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3392 msgid "soft reboot" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3395 msgid "" "A controlled reboot where a VM instance is properly restarted through " "operating system commands." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3397 msgid "Software Development Lifecycle Automation service" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3400 msgid "" "OpenStack project that aims to make cloud services easier to consume and " "integrate with application development process by automating the source-to-" "image process, and simplifying app-centric deployment. The project name is " "solum." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3404 msgid "SolidFire Volume Driver" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3407 msgid "The Block Storage driver for the SolidFire iSCSI storage appliance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3409 msgid "solum" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3412 msgid "" "OpenStack project that provides a Software Development Lifecycle Automation " "service." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3414 msgid "SPICE" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3417 msgid "" "The Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments (SPICE) provides " "remote desktop access to guest virtual machines. It is an alternative to " "VNC. SPICE is supported by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3420 msgid "spread-first scheduler" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3423 msgid "" "The Compute VM scheduling algorithm that attempts to start a new VM on the " "host with the least amount of load." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3425 msgid "SQL-Alchemy" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3428 msgid "An open source SQL toolkit for Python, used in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3429 msgid "SQLite" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3432 msgid "" "A lightweight SQL database, used as the default persistent storage method in " "many OpenStack services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3434 msgid "stack" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3437 msgid "" "A set of OpenStack resources created and managed by the Orchestration " "service according to a given template (either an AWS CloudFormation template " "or a Heat Orchestration Template (HOT))." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3441 msgid "StackTach" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3444 msgid "" "Community project that captures Compute AMQP communications; useful for " "debugging." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3446 msgid "static IP address" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3449 msgid "Alternative term for a fixed IP address." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3450 msgid "StaticWeb" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3453 msgid "" "WSGI middleware component of Object Storage that serves container data as a " "static web page." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3455 msgid "storage back end" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3458 msgid "" "The method that a service uses for persistent storage, such as iSCSI, NFS, " "or local disk." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3460 msgid "storage node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3463 msgid "" "An Object Storage node that provides container services, account services, " "and object services; controls the account databases, container databases, " "and object storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3466 msgid "storage manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3469 msgid "" "A XenAPI component that provides a pluggable interface to support a wide " "variety of persistent storage back ends." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3471 msgid "storage manager back end" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3474 msgid "A persistent storage method supported by XenAPI, such as iSCSI or NFS." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3476 msgid "storage services" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3479 msgid "" "Collective name for the Object Storage object services, container services, " "and account services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3481 msgid "strategy" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3484 msgid "" "Specifies the authentication source used by Image service or Identity. In " "the Database service, it refers to the extensions implemented for a data " "store." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3487 msgid "subdomain" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3490 msgid "" "A domain within a parent domain. Subdomains cannot be registered. Subdomains " "enable you to delegate domains. Subdomains can themselves have subdomains, " "so third-level, fourth-level, fifth-level, and deeper levels of nesting are " "possible." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3494 msgid "subnet" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3497 msgid "Logical subdivision of an IP network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3498 msgid "SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3502 msgid "suspend" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3505 msgid "Alternative term for a paused VM instance." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3506 msgid "swap" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3509 msgid "" "Disk-based virtual memory used by operating systems to provide more memory " "than is actually available on the system." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3511 msgid "swauth" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3514 msgid "" "An authentication and authorization service for Object Storage, implemented " "through WSGI middleware; uses Object Storage itself as the persistent " "backing store." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3520 msgid "An OpenStack core project that provides object storage services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3522 msgid "swift All in One (SAIO)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3525 msgid "" "Creates a full Object Storage development environment within a single VM." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3527 msgid "swift middleware" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3530 msgid "" "Collective term for Object Storage components that provide additional " "functionality." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3532 msgid "swift proxy server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3535 msgid "" "Acts as the gatekeeper to Object Storage and is responsible for " "authenticating the user." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3537 msgid "swift storage node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3540 msgid "" "A node that runs Object Storage account, container, and object services." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3542 msgid "sync point" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3545 msgid "" "Point in time since the last container and accounts database sync among " "nodes within Object Storage." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3547 msgid "sysadmin" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3550 msgid "" "One of the default roles in the Compute RBAC system. Enables a user to add " "other users to a project, interact with VM images that are associated with " "the project, and start and stop VM instances." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3553 msgid "system usage" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3556 msgid "" "A Compute component that, along with the notification system, collects " "meters and usage information. This information can be used for billing." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3562 msgid "" "An integrated project that provides metering and measuring facilities for " "OpenStack. The project name of Telemetry is ceilometer." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3565 msgid "TempAuth" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3568 msgid "" "An authentication facility within Object Storage that enables Object Storage " "itself to perform authentication and authorization. Frequently used in " "testing and development." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3571 msgid "Tempest" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3574 msgid "" "Automated software test suite designed to run against the trunk of the " "OpenStack core project." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3576 msgid "TempURL" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3579 msgid "" "An Object Storage middleware component that enables creation of URLs for " "temporary object access." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3581 msgid "tenant" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3584 msgid "" "A group of users; used to isolate access to Compute resources. An " "alternative term for a project." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3586 msgid "Tenant API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3589 msgid "An API that is accessible to tenants." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3590 msgid "tenant endpoint" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3593 msgid "" "An Identity service API endpoint that is associated with one or more tenants." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3595 msgid "tenant ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3598 msgid "" "Unique ID assigned to each tenant within the Identity service. The project " "IDs map to the tenant IDs." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3600 msgid "token" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3603 msgid "" "An alpha-numeric string of text used to access OpenStack APIs and resources." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3605 msgid "token services" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3608 msgid "" "An Identity service component that manages and validates tokens after a user " "or tenant has been authenticated." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3610 msgid "tombstone" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3613 msgid "" "Used to mark Object Storage objects that have been deleted; ensures that the " "object is not updated on another node after it has been deleted." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3616 msgid "topic publisher" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3619 msgid "" "A process that is created when a RPC call is executed; used to push the " "message to the topic exchange." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3621 msgid "Torpedo" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3624 msgid "" "Community project used to run automated tests against the OpenStack API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3626 msgid "transaction ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3629 msgid "" "Unique ID assigned to each Object Storage request; used for debugging and " "tracing." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3631 msgid "transient" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3634 msgid "Alternative term for non-durable." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3635 msgid "transient exchange" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3638 msgid "Alternative term for a non-durable exchange." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3639 msgid "transient message" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3642 msgid "" "A message that is stored in memory and is lost after the server is restarted." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3644 msgid "transient queue" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3647 msgid "Alternative term for a non-durable queue." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3648 msgid "TripleO" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3651 msgid "" "OpenStack-on-OpenStack program. The code name for the OpenStack Deployment " "program." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3656 msgid "OpenStack project that provides database services to applications." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3658 msgid "Ubuntu" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3661 msgid "A Debian-based Linux distribution." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3662 msgid "unscoped token" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3665 msgid "Alternative term for an Identity service default token." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3666 msgid "updater" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3669 msgid "" "Collective term for a group of Object Storage components that processes " "queued and failed updates for containers and objects." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3671 msgid "user" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3674 msgid "" "In OpenStack Identity, entities represent individual API consumers and are " "owned by a specific domain. In OpenStack Compute, a user can be associated " "with roles, projects, or both." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3677 msgid "user data" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3680 msgid "" "A blob of data that the user can specify when they launch an instance. The " "instance can access this data through the metadata service or config drive. " "Commonly used to pass a shell script that the instance runs on boot." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3684 msgid "User Mode Linux (UML)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3688 msgid "VIF UUID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3691 msgid "Unique ID assigned to each Networking VIF." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3692 msgid "VIP" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3695 msgid "" "The primary load balancing configuration object. Specifies the virtual IP " "address and port where client traffic is received. Also defines other " "details such as the load balancing method to be used, protocol, and so on. " "This entity is sometimes known in load-balancing products as a virtual " "server, vserver, or listener." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3701 msgid "Virtual Central Processing Unit (vCPU)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3704 msgid "Subdivides physical CPUs. Instances can then use those divisions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3706 msgid "Virtual Disk Image (VDI)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3711 msgid "VXLAN" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3714 msgid "" "A network virtualization technology that attempts to reduce the scalability " "problems associated with large cloud computing deployments. It uses a VLAN-" "like encapsulation technique to encapsulate Ethernet frames within UDP " "packets." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3718 msgid "Virtual Hard Disk (VHD)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3723 msgid "virtual IP" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3726 msgid "" "An Internet Protocol (IP) address configured on the load balancer for use by " "clients connecting to a service that is load balanced. Incoming connections " "are distributed to back-end nodes based on the configuration of the load " "balancer." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3730 msgid "virtual machine (VM)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3733 msgid "" "An operating system instance that runs on top of a hypervisor. Multiple VMs " "can run at the same time on the same physical host." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3736 msgid "virtual network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3739 msgid "An L2 network segment within Networking." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3740 msgid "virtual networking" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3743 msgid "" "A generic term for virtualization of network functions such as switching, " "routing, load balancing, and security using a combination of VMs and " "overlays on physical network infrastructure." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3747 msgid "Virtual Network Computing (VNC)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3750 msgid "" "Open source GUI and CLI tools used for remote console access to VMs. " "Supported by Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3752 msgid "Virtual Network InterFace (VIF)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3755 msgid "" "An interface that is plugged into a port in a Networking network. Typically " "a virtual network interface belonging to a VM." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3758 msgid "virtual port" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3761 msgid "" "Attachment point where a virtual interface connects to a virtual network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3763 msgid "virtual private network (VPN)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3766 msgid "" "Provided by Compute in the form of cloudpipes, specialized instances that " "are used to create VPNs on a per-project basis." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3768 msgid "virtual server" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3771 msgid "Alternative term for a VM or guest." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3772 msgid "virtual switch (vSwitch)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3775 msgid "" "Software that runs on a host or node and provides the features and functions " "of a hardware-based network switch." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3777 msgid "virtual VLAN" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3780 msgid "Alternative term for a virtual network." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3781 msgid "VirtualBox" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3785 msgid "VLAN manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3788 msgid "" "A Compute component that provides dnsmasq and radvd and sets up forwarding " "to and from cloudpipe instances." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3790 msgid "VLAN network" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3793 msgid "" "The Network Controller provides virtual networks to enable compute servers " "to interact with each other and with the public network. All machines must " "have a public and private network interface. A VLAN network is a private " "network interface, which is controlled by the ``vlan_interface`` option with " "VLAN managers." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3799 msgid "VM disk (VMDK)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3804 msgid "VM image" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3807 msgid "Alternative term for an image." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3808 msgid "VM Remote Control (VMRC)" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3811 msgid "" "Method to access VM instance consoles using a web browser. Supported by " "Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3813 msgid "VMware API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3816 msgid "Supports interaction with VMware products in Compute." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3817 msgid "VMware NSX Neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3820 msgid "Provides support for VMware NSX in Neutron." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3821 msgid "VNC proxy" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3824 msgid "" "A Compute component that provides users access to the consoles of their VM " "instances through VNC or VMRC." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3826 msgid "volume" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3829 msgid "" "Disk-based data storage generally represented as an iSCSI target with a file " "system that supports extended attributes; can be persistent or ephemeral." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3832 msgid "Volume API" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3835 msgid "Alternative name for the Block Storage API." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3836 msgid "volume controller" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3839 msgid "" "A Block Storage component that oversees and coordinates storage volume " "actions." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3841 msgid "volume driver" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3844 msgid "Alternative term for a volume plug-in." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3845 msgid "volume ID" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3848 msgid "" "Unique ID applied to each storage volume under the Block Storage control." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3850 msgid "volume manager" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3853 msgid "" "A Block Storage component that creates, attaches, and detaches persistent " "storage volumes." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3855 msgid "volume node" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3858 msgid "A Block Storage node that runs the cinder-volume daemon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3859 msgid "volume plug-in" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3862 msgid "" "Provides support for new and specialized types of back-end storage for the " "Block Storage volume manager." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3864 msgid "volume worker" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3867 msgid "" "A cinder component that interacts with back-end storage to manage the " "creation and deletion of volumes and the creation of compute volumes, " "provided by the cinder-volume daemon." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3870 msgid "vSphere" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3874 msgid "weighting" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3877 msgid "" "A Compute process that determines the suitability of the VM instances for a " "job for a particular host. For example, not enough RAM on the host, too many " "CPUs on the host, and so on." msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3880 msgid "weight" msgstr "" #: ../common/glossary.rst:3883 msgid "" "Used by Object Storage devices to determine which storage devices are " "suitable for the job.
