commit_message:
Add support for VIF_TYPE_TAP

The networking-calico Neutron driver/plugin uses VIF_TYPE_TAP, so this
change enables using Kuryr with networking-calico

Change-Id: Ic5a079ad4e4d7be73e9fc81145e28bc6ee59bc36

commit_message:
Fix controller-no-external.yaml in bonded configs.

For some reason the controller-no-external.yaml template is configured
for DHCP on the control plane interface. We switched to static control
plane IPs before the controller-no-external.yaml was created (IIRC), so
I'm not sure how that happened. This change brings the
controller-no-external.yaml in line with the rest of the bonded NIC
templates.

Closes-Bug: #1573943
Change-Id: I2ac929e241707db72a0beabf9d5cd7fc14b90f76
(cherry picked from commit 6d27813db3ce06b4352ac42c3e45887030094c39)

commit_message:
NetApp: Use Local Cache to Copy an Available Image

This fixes a defect where a locally cached image is not
always used by the Copy Offload feature. By using an available
image, local to the same backend as the share, performance can be
improved as a clone operation is executed instead of a remote copy.

Also, moved and refactored tests from test_netapp_nfs.py to the
correct test class under the netapp driver test directory. This is
part of the ongoing refactoring of test_netapp_nfs.py to meet
current code standards.

Change-Id: Ia4d4435d81d2f7dabd12582553b89f9b9d5ab38a
Closes-Bug: 1568998

commit_message:
neutron: new 8.1.0 mitaka release

Using 8.1.0 instead of 8.0.1 to reflect the fact that there are some
changes that could require special attention from consumers (f.e.
new router ALLOCATING status added; the number of greenlets used by
neutron-server changed).

Change-Id: I9044eb5f06def3339333b70a755b14538dc9bab7

commit_message:
DNM!!! Let's see what breaks when neutron-debug isn't called

It's not clear what the probe ports created by neutron-debug
are actually used for, so let's see what breaks if we don't
have them.

Change-Id: I7b11e6264bebeae3665ed195539e10e837ced1d8
Signed-off-by: RYAN D. MOATS <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
sahara tests release 0.2.0

Several important bugs were fixed in this release.
Also sahara-tests are moved to independent release scheme
like it's done in tempest. Governance change at [0]

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/308883/
Change-Id: I32b82f7a990fe5bd7c14e4642df0deb3826deb65

commit_message:
acceptance: ignore CLI warnings

Relax beaker CLI tests so we tolerate warnings like:
"Ignoring domain related configs because identity API version is 2.0"

The warnings are present in aggregate & flavor tests.

Change-Id: I1376322147a66a817f52e3cf94f6043e37e799a3

commit_message:
Removed assertions and changed failure keys for command injection test

Change-Id: I4c57fd2436a94a2f382f8a93a88afa9009a5b1c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/syntribos refs/changes/18/310918/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Rackspace # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from syntribos.issue import Issue from syntribos.tests.fuzz import base_fuzz class CommandInjectionBody(base_fuzz.BaseFuzzTestCase): test_name = "COMMAND_INJECTION_BODY" test_type = "data" data_key = "command_injection.txt" ''' response is parsed for this failure keys, which indicate vuln.''' failure_keys = [ 'fuzzing_command_injection', 'gid', 'groups', 'root:x:0:0:'] def test_case(self): self.test_default_issues() failed_strings = self.data_driven_failure_cases() if failed_strings: if 'echo' in self.resp.content: return self.register_issue( Issue(test="command_injection", severity="Medium", confidence="Low", text=("A string known to be commonly returned after a " "successful command injection attack was included in the " "response. This could indicate a vulnerability to " "command injection attacks.").format(failed_strings) ) ) class CommandInjectionParams(CommandInjectionBody): test_name = "COMMAND_INJECTION_PARAMS" test_type = "params" class CommandInjectionHeaders(CommandInjectionBody): test_name = "COMMAND_INJECTION_HEADERS" test_type = "headers" class CommandInjectionURL(CommandInjectionBody): test_name = "COMMAND_INJECTION_URL" test_type = "url" url_var = "FUZZ"

commit_message:
Pass parameters to manage endpoints via puppet

This commit passes the necessary hieradata in order to create
the endpoints, users and roles of the services in keystone via
puppet.

Change-Id: I2470dfa4661be7ba8218f6035fffa05f547214f0

commit_message:
release networking-bgpvpn 3.0.1

Also added definition for 3.0.0 that was released earlier.

Change-Id: I6b8aed51dee118acc824c34cddb737f50f1b69cf

commit_message:
Config options: centralize quobyte libvirt options (14)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then move another options in libvirt section.
This is the 14th patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: I9a95daccc00aeb156fda3515cc667333b224f5a2
Co-Authored-by: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

commit_message:
Config options: centralize volume nfs libvirt options (13)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then move another options in libvirt section.
This is the 13th patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: I435b083892b2f05896c991b7fd1d1a9ba3e0978b

commit_message:
Add a deliverable for puppet-tripleo

Add a deliverable and an initial release (we've never yet tagged one)
for puppet-tripleo.

Note this is going under _independent for now, but we intend on doing
coordinated releases for all tripleo components for each milestone
during the newton cycle ref https://review.openstack.org/#/c/308236/
this is just an initial release that's required for downstream packages
to consume, future releases will be actual newton deliverables.

The hash chosen is based on the most recent current-tripleo delorean,
which is based on our most recent periodic CI job promotion.

Change-Id: I44b0ab5571ac3761c92c49f6ad0ebbb73dec2f71

commit_message:
[Trivial] Remove executable privilege of setup.py

This file actually is not required to be executable.

And openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py is a module rather than
a script, it has main entry but will only used by
`validate-request`, hence doesn't need to be executable as well.

Change-Id: I8791728b296eef1ba60b064fa3a643e839665b1c

commit_message:
Add installguide-cookiecutter repo

Add a new repository to make it easy for new projects to write Install
Guides as discussed in the Newton Install Guide design session.

This repo is owned by the docs team. We will start with an empty
repository without any jobs setup for this.

implements bp project-specific-installguides

Needed-By: I7714905263913ac4ad6ce76fca86c57be367f531
Change-Id: Id3db386827b0b807ba773e972b050db98f28dbe9

commit_message:
Update Trove's README

Updated the README.rst, In which updated about trove, getting
started, python client for trove and reference, Removed the Usage
for integration testing Tests and moved into CONTRIBUTION.rst
Taken reference from other component's README.rst file.

Change-Id: Ic3ce38155ecb120fc6fde1098fabb60be5383a64
Closes-Bug: #1572224

added_lines: ========== Trove is Database as a Service for OpenStack. To provide scalable and reliable Cloud Database as a Service provisioning functionality for both relational and non-relational database engines. Getting Started --------------- If you'd like to run from the master branch, you can clone the git repo: git clone https://github.com/openstack/trove * Wiki: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Trove * Developer Docs: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/trove You can raise bugs here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove Python client ------------- https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-troveclient
deleted_lines: -------- Trove is Database as a Service for OpenStack. ============================= Usage for integration testing ============================= If you'd like to start up a fake Trove API daemon for integration testing with your own tool, run: .. code-block:: bash $ ./tools/start-fake-mode.sh Stop the server with: .. code-block:: bash $ ./tools/stop-fake-mode.sh ====== Tests ====== To run all tests and PEP8, run tox, like so: .. code-block:: bash $ tox To run just the tests for Python 2.7, run: .. code-block:: bash $ tox -epy27 To run just PEP8, run: .. code-block:: bash $ tox -epep8 To generate a coverage report,run: .. code-block:: bash $ tox -ecover (note: on some boxes, the results may not be accurate unless you run it twice) If you want to run only the tests in one file you can use testtools e.g. .. code-block:: bash $ python -m testtools.run trove.tests.unittests.python.module.path

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 01:30:07.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/volume/driver_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_pure.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1058f298e5ac54ae91e98c3874a09c857d04f008', 'message': 'Move initiator_data access to helper methods

This changes the flow for how a driver would access the initiator_data
information. Previously it was passed in at initialize_connection
and then a update dictionary merged in with the return of that method.
We will now just have drivers call helper util methods that can get
and set the data.

There are a few benefits of doing this:

* Drivers can synchronize access to the data, if they need to. It won’t
force any locks are anything on someone who doesn’t care. Future
iterations will make this do a conditional update so drivers won’t need
to use locks around it either.
* No more optional params on initialize_connection, meaning all drivers
have the same signature again.
* Less junk in the manager.
* Less db calls for everyone!

Change-Id: I9b90fafdbf290c7d7141b6ce4f83711f0fcd528f
Closes-Bug: #1578801
Closes-Bug: #1578864'}]
commit_message:
Move initiator_data access to helper methods

This changes the flow for how a driver would access the initiator_data
information. Previously it was passed in at initialize_connection
and then a update dictionary merged in with the return of that method.
We will now just have drivers call helper util methods that can get
and set the data.

There are a few benefits of doing this:

* Drivers can synchronize access to the data, if they need to. It won’t
force any locks are anything on someone who doesn’t care. Future
iterations will make this do a conditional update so drivers won’t need
to use locks around it either.
* No more optional params on initialize_connection, meaning all drivers
have the same signature again.
* Less junk in the manager.
* Less db calls for everyone!

Change-Id: I9b90fafdbf290c7d7141b6ce4f83711f0fcd528f
Closes-Bug: #1578801
Closes-Bug: #1578864

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 14:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/horizon_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon/commit/e1e0a1b56c37eb81d1bc657157726ee2de9c0b4c', 'message': "Fix wsgi_user and wsgi_group in Red Hat platforms

Commit da0cedce6f14f5c35e733ac345d8d862db11cd2b assumed that the
user and group for Horizon in Red Hat platforms was 'dashboard', due
to the following lines being present in openstack-dashboard.conf:

WSGIDaemonProcess dashboard
WSGIProcessGroup dashboard

Change-Id: I52766ac0521951cc8c857e51a61823410585bed5

commit_message:
Fix wsgi_user and wsgi_group in Red Hat platforms

Commit da0cedce6f14f5c35e733ac345d8d862db11cd2b assumed that the
user and group for Horizon in Red Hat platforms was 'dashboard', due
to the following lines being present in openstack-dashboard.conf:

WSGIDaemonProcess dashboard
WSGIProcessGroup dashboard

Actually, based on [1], this does not mean that, and the RPM packages
do not create such user, so we should switch that to the apache user.

[1] http://modwsgi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration-directives/WSGIDaemonProcess.html

Change-Id: I52766ac0521951cc8c857e51a61823410585bed5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/17/314117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implement backend usage reporting

This patch adds an API interface to allow the cloud administrator
to view the amount of free and total storage they have for their
backends, as well as their oversubscription ratio.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Partially-implements: blueprint backend-usage-reporting
Change-Id: I68e7c163c5c3f0ff81827fe6426510938f09f18b
Partial-bug: #1380555
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/44/301444/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Hitachi Data Systems, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import oslo_messaging from cinder.api.contrib import usage from cinder import context from cinder import exception from cinder import test from cinder.tests.unit.api import fakes def rpcapi_get_usage(self, context): usage = { 'name': 'LVM', 'used': 3, 'free': 7, 'total': 10 } return usage class UsageAPITest(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(UsageAPITest, self).setUp() self.controller = usage.UsageController() self.ctxt = context.RequestContext('admin', 'fake', True) @mock.patch('cinder.db.service_get_all') @mock.patch('cinder.volume.rpcapi.VolumeAPI.get_usage', rpcapi_get_usage) def test_usage_summary(self, mock_services): mock_services.return_value = [{'name': 'fake'}] req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/fake/usage') req.environ['cinder.context'] = self.ctxt res = self.controller.index(req) expected = {'usages': [{'name': 'LVM', 'used': 3, 'free': 7, 'total': 10}]} self.assertDictMatch(expected, res) @mock.patch('cinder.db.service_get_all') @mock.patch('cinder.volume.rpcapi.VolumeAPI.get_usage') def test_get_usage_rpc_timeout(self, mock_rpc, mock_services): mock_rpc.side_effect = oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout mock_services.return_value = [{'name': 'fake'}] req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/fake/usage') req.environ['cinder.context'] = self.ctxt self.assertRaises(exception.RPCTimeout, self.controller.index, req)

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 21:58:11.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/04b7a0c2f7d2b1894e7396be00d953c7f1ff315e', 'message': "Experimental fix for Galera issues

commit_message:
Experimental fix for Galera issues

- Fixed GTID parsing
- Moved SST check to mysql_monitor() so that
  it doesn't try to connect to the server when it
  is in process of syncing with other server.

Change-Id: Ib7c932fc63cd52306a232a37f2da687127553174
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/01/306601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --console 2>&1 | grep 'Recovered position' | awk '{print $NF}') # Do not try to connect to the server during SST if [ -f "${OCF_RESKEY_datadir}"/sst_in_progress ]; then ocf_log info "${LH} SST is in progress" return $OCF_SUCCESS fi
deleted_lines: --log-error=/dev/stdout 2>&1 | grep 'Recovered position' | awk '{print $NF}') if [ -f "${OCF_RESKEY_datadir}"/sst_in_progress ]; then ocf_log $loglevel "${LH} SST is in progress" return $OCF_SUCCESS fi

subject: Fix the docstring of skip_unless_config()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-07 02:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/0385e10e4fdd4b91bb68d79a6b6a078ce35014bf', 'message': 'Fix the docstring of skip_unless_config()

The docstring was wrong on skip_unless_config(), and there are some
deep nests in the method.
This patch fixes the docstring and makes the method less depth.

Change-Id: I280c36c5f7692bbea091e850270667b4a71ef163
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the docstring of skip_unless_config()

The docstring was wrong on skip_unless_config(), and there are some
deep nests in the method.
This patch fixes the docstring and makes the method less depth.

Change-Id: I280c36c5f7692bbea091e850270667b4a71ef163

commit_message:
config: remove deprecated ironic.client_log_level

The config option "client_log_level" of the "ironic" section was
deprecated with commit d6baa2ae4d7f18dc2e4845af25c21b95767f46ef since
the Kilo release and this change removes this option.

Closes-Bug: 1365230
Change-Id: I605d4ca5b3924ecf013cbf7e228e713b864d7aa4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/312006/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - The deprecated configuration option ``client_log_level`` of the section ``[ironic]`` got deleted. Please use the config options ``log_config_append`` or ``default_log_levels`` of the ``[DEFAULT]`` section.

commit_message:
Move spec for removing downgrades to right place

The spec for removing downgrades has been approved. The folders for the
specs have been changed in newton and current location of the spec
doens't appear on the correct specs documentation page [1]; rather shows
up on incorrect place [2].

This patch merely moves the spec in the appropriate location.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/newton/index.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/

Change-Id: Iaa9a764e1fb372608e59c41db8173f2a848bf697

commit_message:
Revert "Update auth params in Nova Hypervisor-Ironic"

This seems to break Ironic gate with n-cpu not starting
any more.

This reverts commit c527ded91bef5d4c56cbdb2402a4d68015364b37.

Change-Id: Idfb01448e8ecf53fbd2e1df61c8f08f3107981ac
Closes-Bug: #1579683

subject: Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 02:08:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/9205180a90f99db971eb80bcc6c54e82e0a9bc3f', 'message': 'Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug

dynamic_inventory.py implements a test to check for
duplicate IP addresses in user supplied inventory.
A test has been written which asserts the output of
the error raised by MultipleHostsWithOneIPError to
equal a string in which two hostnames appear.  Since
the inventory created in dynamic_inventory is a python
dictionary, the ordering of the elements cannot be
guarenteed.  This will cause an occasional failure
during automated testing.

This patch creates a small list of the hostnames
supplied to MultipleHostsWithOneIPError, sorts the
list, and supplies the list index values in place
of the variable names directly.  This will ensure
that our exception text will always match our
assertion during testing.

Change-Id: I43b3c637a3944efb705b5c4f495ab3dba1faf893
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-05 15:43:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/6eb1ae784fac1e28e61f63cebcef3fbb103c69fe', 'message': 'Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug

dynamic_inventory.py implements a test to check for
duplicate hosts assigned to the same IP address
in user supplied inventory.

A test has been written which asserts the output of
the error raised by MultipleHostsWithOneIPError to
equal a string in which two hostnames appear.  Since
the inventory created in dynamic_inventory is a python
dictionary, the ordering of the elements cannot be
guarenteed.  This will cause an occasional failure
during automated testing.

This patch creates a small list of the hostnames
supplied to MultipleHostsWithOneIPError, sorts the
list, and supplies the list index values in place
of the variable names directly.  This will ensure
that our exception text will always match our
assertion during testing.

Change-Id: I43b3c637a3944efb705b5c4f495ab3dba1faf893
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-05 17:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/32fd0e7facfe661d221a2ebe23de4482a8d2ee6f', 'message': 'Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug

dynamic_inventory.py implements a test to check for
duplicate hosts assigned to the same IP address
in user supplied inventory.

A test has been written which asserts the output of
the error raised by MultipleHostsWithOneIPError to
equal a string in which two hostnames appear.  Since
the inventory created in dynamic_inventory is a python
dictionary, the ordering of the elements cannot be
guarenteed.  This will cause an occasional failure
during automated testing.

This patch creates a small list of the hostnames
supplied to MultipleHostsWithOneIPError, sorts the
list, and supplies the list index values in place
of the variable names directly.  This will ensure
that our exception text will always match our
assertion during testing.

Change-Id: I43b3c637a3944efb705b5c4f495ab3dba1faf893
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug

dynamic_inventory.py implements a test to check for
duplicate hosts assigned to the same IP address
in user supplied inventory.

A test has been written which asserts the output of
the error raised by MultipleHostsWithOneIPError to
equal a string in which two hostnames appear.  Since
the inventory created in dynamic_inventory is a python
dictionary, the ordering of the elements cannot be
guarenteed.  This will cause an occasional failure
during automated testing.

This patch creates a small list of the hostnames
supplied to MultipleHostsWithOneIPError, sorts the
list, and supplies the list index values in place
of the variable names directly.  This will ensure
that our exception text will always match our
assertion during testing.

Change-Id: I43b3c637a3944efb705b5c4f495ab3dba1faf893
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/08/312808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix notification listeners usage

Closes-Bug: #1570468

Create the single notification pipeline listener and to aggregate
targets and endpoints in it.

In this implementation the incoming notification msg will be dispatched
in a relevant endpoint by its own filter rule based on publisher id
of a notifier, which sent this message.

Each pipeline notifier has a conforming publisher id based on
a pipeline name in which it to produce messages.

(cherry picked from commit 3bbb67d)

Change-Id: I8d4ae7a4c0d8db1757977266e9052cf161b87bc0

subject: Expose allow parameters for URL discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-23 05:18:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/a308337f94a3489713a5339569ec4b151086996c', 'message': "Pass kwargs from get_endpoint into URL discovery

In the BaseIdentityPlugin class, the get_endpoint kwargs represents the
endpoint filters[1]. If we simply pass this on to the Discover object,
it will be translated into the allow_experimental, allow_deprecated,
allow_unknown, and any other allow_ parameters that may be added to the
raw_version_data method in the future[2].

Now an Adapter can be used like this (this example would be expected to
fail since it disallows the deprecated volume API):

    auth = Password(<auth_params>)
    sess = session.Session(auth=auth)
    adptr = adapter.Adapter(sess)
    adptr.get('<project-id>/volumes',
              endpoint_filter={'service_type': 'volume',
                               'interface': 'public',
                               'version': 1,
                               'allow_deprecated': False}))

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/session.py?id=9d51a2ae6052dee46198ed3799365a6480cb42c4#n401

commit_message:
Expose allow parameters for URL discovery

The Discover class can fiilter API versions by experimental status, deprecated
status, and unknown status, and potentially more designations in the future.
The parameters that control this were not exposed in the Session or Adapter, so
users could not take advantage of this filtering through normal means. This
patch creates an 'allow' parameter for the Adapter that will get passed down as
keyword arguments into Discover.raw_version_data().

Now, given an unversioned endpoint like:

    $ openstack endpoint show cinder
    +--------------+----------------------------------+
    | Field        | Value                            |
    +--------------+----------------------------------+
    | adminurl     | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | enabled      | True                             |
    | id           | 485107c1d92b41829c331a2dc82aaaeb |
    | internalurl  | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | publicurl    | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | region       | RegionOne                        |
    | service_id   | 01b4f36a173d4c59b31fc95763095373 |
    | service_name | cinder                           |
    | service_type | volume                           |
    +--------------+----------------------------------+

an Adapter can be used like this (this example would be expected to fail
since it disallows the deprecated volume V1 API):

    auth = Password(<auth_params>)
    sess = session.Session(auth=auth)
    adptr = adapter.Adapter(sess)
    adptr.get('<project-id>/volumes',
              endpoint_filter={'service_type': 'volume',
                               'interface': 'public',
                               'version': 1},
              allow={'allow_deprecated': False}))

This is inspired by an abandoned patch to keystoneclient[1] that exposed this
information as a tuple. The problem with exposing it like that is that
raw_version_data() defaults allow_deprecated to True, so including 'deprecated'
in the tuple or not including it would have the same result. Using a dict
allows us to keep the Discover interface the same.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130159

Co-authored-by: Endre Karlson <endre.karlson@hp.com>

Change-Id: I54c29e1c2a4a2b02a3967f4ea108b8d2533616eb
Closes-bug: #1394245

commit_message:
Prevent spawning two VPN agents

Currently, if the VPN devstack plugin is enabled (which is
the method used for VPN in all test jobs), there will be
two VPN agent processes started. This doesn't seem to
affect the tests, but is incorrect.

To resolve this, the proposal is to do this in two steps.
With this commit, the script is modified to start the q-vpn
process, if q-vpn is enabled (legacy), and to only start
q-l3 process, if neither q-vpn nor neutron-vpnaas is enabled.

Once committed, the opertion will be the same - if no VPN
service is enabled, we get q-l3 (correct); if legacy q-vpn is
enabled (only), we get q-vpn (correct); if the plugin is used
(the default), we get two q-vpn processes started (wrong).

With a separate plugin commit (to be pushed next), the plugin
will be renamed to neutron-vpnaas, and then we'll get only
one agent process (q-vpn or neutron-vpnaas) runing. We can't
commit the plugin first, because both the VPN agent and the
q-l3 agent will be started at once (just as bad, if not worse).

Change-Id: I2bb7ac01e619c8a9b22bd517a4ff60d67035dfed
Partial-Bug: 1484141
(cherry picked from commit e4289c88c8007ae942a18a1786fc6fd36f2489c7)

commit_message:
Place priorities list in reverse chronological order

Place priorities list in reverse chronological order

It is now:
   * Newton Priorities
   * Mitaka Priorities

Usually people are concerned with the most recent priorities.

Change-Id: I6632c4e7f95a6896352ee4b3de56422ddf475407

commit_message:
Add Policy Problems spec

WIP - DO NOT MERGE

A look at how we can make it easier for operators when modifying API
policy configuration across various projects.

This is not really a spec, its a collection of problems that need to be
solved by a collection of efforts across various projects. Might need to
move into the PWG user stories, or similar.

Change-Id: Icb77f5dac448d9929f86e3afe8ce8ecd8f7ec8a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-specs refs/changes/86/298686/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================= Easier Policy Modifications ============================= At recent operators meetups, when configuration has been discussed the current difficulty around modify policy configuration has been raised. It seems most has to restore the default policy configuration files in order to get a working system Problem description =================== Many projects have a very limited default policy file. If we have a better range of roles available in the default policy file, we can avoid the need for many operators to edit the policy file at all. When moving between projects, ideally they would all follow common patterns for the default policy. Across upgrades, it can be hard to understand the changes that have happened to the default policy file, and how that relates to modifications you have made to the previous default policy file. It to identify new policy rules vs name changes vs new defaults. The trend towards microversions over API extensions, now means if you don't want users to have access to a particular API, you must modify the policy. Previously you could changing the list of enabled extensions. When trying to create a new role, or modifying a particular API call, it is currently very hard to find the specific policy rule without reading the source code. There is no description for the specific policy. In many cases the default policy is such that many different policy changes are required to enable one specific API call. End users also have issues discovering what they are allowed to do with a particular API. Exposing the current policy configuration would simply expose end users to all the problems deployers are currently facing when trying to understand the policy configuration. This is complicated by there being other reasons why certain actions are not allowed, outside of policy restrictions, for example being unable to resize a server while a snapshot is happening. Defcore helps by setting a minimum number of actions all users should have access to, but this does not help with more optional features, often relating to two possible ways to achieve the same aim, that are technology specific, and we are not able to abstracted into a single operation. Proposed change =============== Use oslo.conf to get policy --------------------------- We have already established patterns around configuration with oslo.config, so I propose we make it possible to use olso.config to provide the current options to the olso.policy engine. We can read the config from a policy.conf file, that will, after a deprecation cycle, replace policy.json. The default can be an empty file, or you can generate a sample file with all the options commented out. Some observations around adopting this approach: * the default values are stored in the code * we use a generator * there is a description of what that configuration changes * we have the ability rename options through deprecated names Agree set of conventions for typical default roles -------------------------------------------------- Lets set a new convention for the default list of roles that are mentioned in all projects policy file: * If you are in a specific project, default is no access to any service * Service and Project scoped roles: * Default project scoped user (e.g. role:nova_project_user) is able to create and delete all objects belonging to their project * Project scoped observer (e.g. role:nova_project_observer) allows monitoring systems to list objects * Project scoped creator (e.g. role:nova_project_creator) this allows any non-destructive action. So you can snapshot and create servers, but you can't delete or resize servers. * To make this simpler, anything the anything the creator can do can also be done by the user, anything the observer can do can do, can be done by the creator and user. * Service scoped "global" roles: * Service specific global admin (e.g. role:nova_global_admin) is allowed to do anything in that specific service, across objects belonging to any user * Service specific observer (e.g. rule:nova_global_observer) is to allow support stuff to know what servers each user might have, but they are not able to modify the servers * TODO - should we have a role that allows non-destructive actions, such as live-migrate, across all projects? * Each service has a global rule (e.g. role:neutron_global_service that nova will allow to send network events into Nova) Policy Config to match URL endpoint ----------------------------------- We need to create a new opt types in oslo.config that allows you to validate the file is correct. We must have checks in oslo.polcy to ensure any referenced rules are actually defined. The default section holds rules that can be referenced in other sections. The rules can reference any bit of context object, in the usual way. For example: * rule=is_admin:"role:admin" * rule=admin_or_owner:"rule:is_admin or project_id:%(project_id)s" We can have a configuration group for each endpoint. For Nova you would get groups such as: * flavors * os-aggregates * servers * servers.metadata For example: TODO... Alternatives ------------ We could do nothing, but operators have issues that need fixing. There are proposals to store all policy in keystone, in a central location. But it feels like getting a better understanding of policy in each project would be a pre-requisite to more centralization efforts. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * John Garbutt (johnthetubaguy) * TODO... Work Items ---------- TODO Dependencies ============ - Categories and Centralize configuration?
